	<h1 id="firstHeading" class="firstHeading" >Cristiano Ronaldo</h1>
	<div id="bodyContent" class="mw-body-content">
		<div id="siteSub" class="noprint">From Wikipedia, the free encyclopedia</div>
		<div id="contentSub"></div>
		<div id="contentSub2"></div>
		
		<div id="jump-to-nav"></div>
		<a class="mw-jump-link" href="#mw-head">Jump to navigation</a>
		<a class="mw-jump-link" href="#searchInput">Jump to search</a>
		<div id="mw-content-text" lang="en" dir="ltr" class="mw-content-ltr"><div class="mw-parser-output"><div class="shortdescription nomobile noexcerpt noprint searchaux" style="display:none">Portuguese footballer</div>
<div role="note" class="hatnote navigation-not-searchable">"Cristiano" redirects here. For other people named Cristiano, see <a href="/wiki/Cristiano_(given_name)" title="Cristiano (given name)">Cristiano (given name)</a> and <a href="/wiki/Cristiano_(surname)" title="Cristiano (surname)">Cristiano (surname)</a>.</div>
<p class="mw-empty-elt">


</p>
<div role="note" class="hatnote navigation-not-searchable">This name uses <a href="/wiki/Portuguese_name" title="Portuguese name">Portuguese naming customs</a>: the first or maternal <a href="/wiki/Surname" title="Surname">family name</a> is <i>dos Santos</i>&#32;and the second or paternal family name is <i>Aveiro</i>.</div>

<th colspan="3" style="text-align:center;vertical-align:middle;background-color:#cccccc;"><span class="nowrap"><a href="/wiki/FIFA_Confederations_Cup" title="FIFA Confederations Cup">FIFA Confederations Cup</a></span>
</th></tr>
<tr>
<td style="text-align:center;vertical-align:middle;"><img alt="Third place" src="//upload.wikimedia.org/wikipedia/commons/thumb/8/89/Bronze_medal_icon.svg/16px-Bronze_medal_icon.svg.png" decoding="async" title="Third place" width="16" height="16" srcset="//upload.wikimedia.org/wikipedia/commons/thumb/8/89/Bronze_medal_icon.svg/24px-Bronze_medal_icon.svg.png 1.5x, //upload.wikimedia.org/wikipedia/commons/thumb/8/89/Bronze_medal_icon.svg/32px-Bronze_medal_icon.svg.png 2x" data-file-width="16" data-file-height="16" /></td>
<td style="text-align:center;vertical-align:middle;"><span class="nowrap"><a href="/wiki/2017_FIFA_Confederations_Cup" title="2017 FIFA Confederations Cup">2017 Russia</a></span></td>
<td style="text-align:center;vertical-align:middle;">
</td></tr></tbody></table>
</div></div></th></tr><tr><td colspan="4" style="text-align:center;white-space: nowrap; vertical-align: baseline">
<p class="mw-empty-elt">
</p>
<table style="text-align:left; width:100%; margin:0; border-spacing:0; line-height: normal">

</td></tr><tr><th colspan="2" style="text-align:center">Signature</th></tr><tr><td colspan="2" style="text-align:center"><a href="/wiki/File:Cristiano_Ronaldo_Signature.svg" class="image" title="Cristiano Ronaldo signature"><img alt="Cristiano Ronaldo signature" src="//upload.wikimedia.org/wikipedia/commons/thumb/7/76/Cristiano_Ronaldo_Signature.svg/150px-Cristiano_Ronaldo_Signature.svg.png" decoding="async" width="150" height="94" srcset="//upload.wikimedia.org/wikipedia/commons/thumb/7/76/Cristiano_Ronaldo_Signature.svg/225px-Cristiano_Ronaldo_Signature.svg.png 1.5x, //upload.wikimedia.org/wikipedia/commons/thumb/7/76/Cristiano_Ronaldo_Signature.svg/300px-Cristiano_Ronaldo_Signature.svg.png 2x" data-file-width="266" data-file-height="166" /></a></td></tr>

.sidebar-list-title{text-align:left;font-weight:bold;line-height:1.6em;font-size:105%}@media(max-width:720px){body.mediawiki .mw-parser-output .sidebar{width:100%!important;clear:both;float:none!important;margin-left:0!important;margin-right:0!important}}</style><table class="sidebar nomobile vcard hlist" style="border: 4px double #960018;&quot;"><tbody><tr><th class="sidebar-title" style="font-size: 100%; padding: 0; line-height: 150%;"><table><tbody><tr>
<td style="background:#960018;"><a href="/wiki/File:Cristiano_Ronaldo_2018.jpg" class="image"><img alt="A man in a red shirt looks to his right." src="//upload.wikimedia.org/wikipedia/commons/thumb/8/8c/Cristiano_Ronaldo_2018.jpg/75px-Cristiano_Ronaldo_2018.jpg" decoding="async" width="75" height="113" class="thumbborder" srcset="//upload.wikimedia.org/wikipedia/commons/thumb/8/8c/Cristiano_Ronaldo_2018.jpg/113px-Cristiano_Ronaldo_2018.jpg 1.5x, //upload.wikimedia.org/wikipedia/commons/thumb/8/8c/Cristiano_Ronaldo_2018.jpg/150px-Cristiano_Ronaldo_2018.jpg 2x" data-file-width="613" data-file-height="920" /></a></td>
<td style="background:#960018;"><span style="font-size:0.8em;"><span style="color:#FFF">This article is part of a series about</span></span><br /><span class="vcard"><span class="fn"><span style="font-size:1.35em;"><a class="mw-selflink selflink"><span style="color:#FFF">Cristiano Ronaldo</span></a></span></span></span></td>
</tr></tbody></table></th></tr><tr><td class="sidebar-content" style="padding:0.3em;">
<p><b><a href="/wiki/Portuguese_people" title="Portuguese people"><span style="color:#000">Portuguese</span></a> <a href="/wiki/Football_player" title="Football player"><span style="color:#000">professional footballer</span></a></b><br />
</p>

<p><b>Films</b>
</p>
<ul><li><i><a href="/wiki/Cristiano_Ronaldo:_The_World_at_His_Feet" title="Cristiano Ronaldo: The World at His Feet">Cristiano Ronaldo: The World at His Feet</a></i></li>
<li><i><a href="/wiki/Ronaldo_(film)" title="Ronaldo (film)">Ronaldo</a></i></li></ul></td>
</tr><tr><td class="sidebar-navbar" style="text-align:center;"><style data-mw-deduplicate="TemplateStyles:r992953826">.mw-parser-output .navbar{display:inline;font-size:88%;font-weight:normal}.mw-parser-output .navbar-collapse{float:left;text-align:left}.mw-parser-output .navbar-boxtext{word-spacing:0}.mw-parser-output .navbar ul{display:inline-block;white-space:nowrap;line-height:inherit}.mw-parser-output .navbar-brackets::before{margin-right:-0.125em;content:"[ "}.mw-parser-output .navbar-brackets::after{margin-left:-0.125em;content:" ]"}.mw-parser-output .navbar li{word-spacing:-0.125em}.mw-parser-output .navbar-mini abbr{font-variant:small-caps;border-bottom:none;text-decoration:none;cursor:inherit}.mw-parser-output .navbar-ct-full{font-size:114%;margin:0 7em}.mw-parser-output .navbar-ct-mini{font-size:114%;margin:0 4em}.mw-parser-output .infobox .navbar{font-size:100%}.mw-parser-output .navbox .navbar{display:block;font-size:100%}.mw-parser-output .navbox-title .navbar{float:left;text-align:left;margin-right:0.5em}</style><div class="navbar plainlinks hlist navbar-mini"><ul><li class="nv-view"><a href="/wiki/Template:Cristiano_Ronaldo_series" title="Template:Cristiano Ronaldo series"><abbr title="View this template">v</abbr></a></li><li class="nv-talk"><a href="/wiki/Template_talk:Cristiano_Ronaldo_series" title="Template talk:Cristiano Ronaldo series"><abbr title="Discuss this template">t</abbr></a></li><li class="nv-edit"><a class="external text" href="https://en.wikipedia.org/w/index.php?title=Template:Cristiano_Ronaldo_series&amp;action=edit"><abbr title="Edit this template">e</abbr></a></li></ul></div></td></tr></tbody></table>
<p><b>Cristiano Ronaldo dos Santos Aveiro</b> <span style="font-size:85%;"><a href="/wiki/Order_of_Prince_Henry" title="Order of Prince Henry">GOIH</a> <a href="/wiki/Order_of_Merit_(Portugal)" title="Order of Merit (Portugal)">ComM</a></span> (<span style="font-size:85%;">Portuguese pronunciation:&#160;</span><span title="Representation in the International Phonetic Alphabet (IPA)" class="IPA"><a href="/wiki/Help:IPA/Portuguese" title="Help:IPA/Portuguese">[kitjnu nadu]</a></span>; born 5 February 1985) is a Portuguese professional <a href="/wiki/Association_football" title="Association football">footballer</a> who plays as a <a href="/wiki/Forward_(association_football)" title="Forward (association football)">forward</a> for <a href="/wiki/Serie_A" title="Serie A">Serie A</a> club <a href="/wiki/Juventus_F.C." title="Juventus F.C.">Juventus</a> and <a href="/wiki/Captain_(association_football)" title="Captain (association football)">captains</a> the <a href="/wiki/Portugal_national_football_team" title="Portugal national football team">Portugal national team</a>. Often considered the best player in the world and  widely regarded as one of the greatest players of all time, Ronaldo has won five <a href="/wiki/Ballon_d%27Or" title="Ballon d&#39;Or">Ballon d'Or</a> awards<sup id="cite_ref-12" class="reference"><a href="#cite_note-12">&#91;note 3&#93;</a></sup> and four <a href="/wiki/European_Golden_Shoe" title="European Golden Shoe">European Golden Shoes</a>, both of which are records for a European player. He has won <a href="/wiki/List_of_career_achievements_by_Cristiano_Ronaldo#Collective_awards" title="List of career achievements by Cristiano Ronaldo">31 major trophies in his career</a>, including seven league titles, five <a href="/wiki/UEFA_Champions_League" title="UEFA Champions League">UEFA Champions Leagues</a>, one <a href="/wiki/UEFA_European_Championship" title="UEFA European Championship">UEFA European Championship</a>, and one <a href="/wiki/UEFA_Nations_League" title="UEFA Nations League">UEFA Nations League</a> title. Ronaldo holds the records for the most goals (134) and assists (42) in the history of the UEFA Champions League.<sup id="cite_ref-13" class="reference"><a href="#cite_note-13">&#91;10&#93;</a></sup> He is one of the few recorded players to have made over <a href="/wiki/List_of_footballers_with_the_most_official_appearances" title="List of footballers with the most official appearances">1,000 professional career appearances</a> and has scored a record <a href="/wiki/List_of_footballers_with_500_or_more_goals" title="List of footballers with 500 or more goals">770 senior career goals</a> for club and country.<sup id="cite_ref-14" class="reference"><a href="#cite_note-14">&#91;11&#93;</a></sup> He is also the second male to score <a href="/wiki/List_of_men%27s_footballers_with_50_or_more_international_goals" title="List of men&#39;s footballers with 50 or more international goals">100 international goals</a> and the first European one to achieve the feat.<sup id="cite_ref-15" class="reference"><a href="#cite_note-15">&#91;12&#93;</a></sup>
</p><p>Born and raised in <a href="/wiki/Madeira" title="Madeira">Madeira</a>, Ronaldo began his senior club career playing for <a href="/wiki/Sporting_CP" title="Sporting CP">Sporting CP</a>, before signing with <a href="/wiki/Manchester_United_F.C." title="Manchester United F.C.">Manchester United</a> in 2003, aged 18. After winning the <a href="/wiki/FA_Cup" title="FA Cup">FA Cup</a> in his first season, he helped United win three successive <a href="/wiki/Premier_League" title="Premier League">Premier League</a> titles, the UEFA Champions League, and the <a href="/wiki/FIFA_Club_World_Cup" title="FIFA Club World Cup">FIFA Club World Cup</a>; at age 23, he won his first Ballon d'Or. In 2009, Ronaldo was the subject of the then-<a href="/wiki/Most_expensive_association_football_transfer" class="mw-redirect" title="Most expensive association football transfer">most expensive association football transfer</a> when signed for <a href="/wiki/Real_Madrid_CF" title="Real Madrid CF">Real Madrid</a> in a <a href="/wiki/Transfer_(association_football)" title="Transfer (association football)">transfer</a> worth €94&#160;million (£80&#160;million). There, he won 15 trophies, including two <a href="/wiki/La_Liga" title="La Liga">La Liga</a> titles, two <a href="/wiki/Copa_del_Rey" title="Copa del Rey">Copas del Rey</a>, and four UEFA Champions League titles, and became <a href="/wiki/List_of_Real_Madrid_CF_records_and_statistics#Goalscorers" title="List of Real Madrid CF records and statistics">the club's all-time top goalscorer</a>. After joining Madrid, Ronaldo finished runner-up for the Ballon d'Or three times, behind <a href="/wiki/Lionel_Messi" title="Lionel Messi">Lionel Messi</a> – his perceived <a href="/wiki/Messi%E2%80%93Ronaldo_rivalry" title="Messi–Ronaldo rivalry">career rival</a> – before winning back-to-back Ballons d'Or from <a href="/wiki/2013_FIFA_Ballon_d%27Or" title="2013 FIFA Ballon d&#39;Or">2013</a>–<a href="/wiki/2014_FIFA_Ballon_d%27Or" title="2014 FIFA Ballon d&#39;Or">2014</a> and again from <a href="/wiki/2016_Ballon_d%27Or" title="2016 Ballon d&#39;Or">2016</a>–<a href="/wiki/2017_Ballon_d%27Or" title="2017 Ballon d&#39;Or">2017</a>. After winning a <a href="/wiki/2018_UEFA_Champions_League_Final" title="2018 UEFA Champions League Final">third consecutive Champions League</a> title in 2018, Ronaldo became the first player to win the trophy five times.<sup id="cite_ref-16" class="reference"><a href="#cite_note-16">&#91;13&#93;</a></sup> In 2018, he signed for Juventus in a transfer worth an initial €100 million (£88&#160;million), the highest fee ever paid by an Italian club and the highest ever paid for a player over 30 years old. He won the <a href="/wiki/Serie_A" title="Serie A">Serie A</a> title in his first two seasons with the club.
</p><p>Ronaldo made his senior international debut for Portugal in 2003 at age 18, and has since earned <a href="/wiki/List_of_men%27s_footballers_with_100_or_more_international_caps" title="List of men&#39;s footballers with 100 or more international caps">170 caps</a>, including appearing and scoring in ten major tournaments, becoming <a href="/wiki/Portugal_national_football_team#Most_capped_players" title="Portugal national football team">Portugal's most capped player</a> and <a href="/wiki/Portugal_national_football_team#Top_goalscorers" title="Portugal national football team">his country's all-time top goalscorer</a>. He scored his first international goal at <a href="/wiki/UEFA_Euro_2004" title="UEFA Euro 2004">Euro 2004</a> where he helped Portugal reach <a href="/wiki/UEFA_Euro_2004_Final" title="UEFA Euro 2004 Final">the final</a> and assumed <a href="/wiki/List_of_Portugal_national_football_team_captains" title="List of Portugal national football team captains">full captaincy</a> of the national team in July 2008. In 2015 Ronaldo was named the best Portuguese player of all time by the <a href="/wiki/Portuguese_Football_Federation" title="Portuguese Football Federation">Portuguese Football Federation</a>. The following year he led Portugal to their first triumph in a major tournament by winning <a href="/wiki/UEFA_Euro_2016" title="UEFA Euro 2016">Euro 2016</a>, and received the <a href="/wiki/UEFA_Euro_2016#Awards" title="UEFA Euro 2016">Silver Boot</a> as the second-highest goalscorer of the tournament.
</p><p>One of the most marketable and famous athletes in the world, Ronaldo was ranked the <a href="/wiki/Forbes%27_list_of_the_world%27s_highest-paid_athletes" title="Forbes&#39; list of the world&#39;s highest-paid athletes">world's highest-paid athlete</a> by <i><a href="/wiki/Forbes" title="Forbes">Forbes</a></i> in 2016 and 2017 and the world's most famous athlete by <a href="/wiki/ESPN" title="ESPN">ESPN</a> from 2016 to 2019. <i><a href="/wiki/Time_(magazine)" title="Time (magazine)">Time</a></i> included him on their list of the <a href="/wiki/Time_100" title="Time 100">100 most influential people in the world</a> in 2014.<sup id="cite_ref-17" class="reference"><a href="#cite_note-17">&#91;14&#93;</a></sup> Ronaldo is the first footballer, as well as only the third sportsman, to earn $1 billion in their career.<sup id="cite_ref-18" class="reference"><a href="#cite_note-18">&#91;15&#93;</a></sup>
</p>
<style data-mw-deduplicate="TemplateStyles:r886046785">.mw-parser-output .toclimit-2 .toclevel-1 ul,.mw-parser-output .toclimit-3 .toclevel-2 ul,.mw-parser-output .toclimit-4 .toclevel-3 ul,.mw-parser-output .toclimit-5 .toclevel-4 ul,.mw-parser-output .toclimit-6 .toclevel-5 ul,.mw-parser-output .toclimit-7 .toclevel-6 ul{display:none}</style><div class="toclimit-4"><div id="toc" class="toc" role="navigation" aria-labelledby="mw-toc-heading"><input type="checkbox" role="button" id="toctogglecheckbox" class="toctogglecheckbox" style="display:none" /><div class="toctitle" lang="en" dir="ltr"><h2 id="mw-toc-heading">Contents</h2><span class="toctogglespan"><label class="toctogglelabel" for="toctogglecheckbox"></label></span></div>

<li class="toclevel-1 tocsection-28"><a href="#Outside_football"><span class="tocnumber">5</span> <span class="toctext">Outside football</span></a></li>
<li class="toclevel-1 tocsection-29"><a href="#Personal_life"><span class="tocnumber">6</span> <span class="toctext">Personal life</span></a>
<ul>
<li class="toclevel-2 tocsection-30"><a href="#Family,_children_and_relationships"><span class="tocnumber">6.1</span> <span class="toctext">Family, children and relationships</span></a></li>

</ul>
</li>
<li class="toclevel-1 tocsection-36"><a href="#Honours"><span class="tocnumber">8</span> <span class="toctext">Honours</span></a></li>

</ul>
</div>
</div>
<h2><span class="mw-headline" id="Early_life">Early life</span></h2>
<p>Cristiano Ronaldo dos Santos Aveiro was born in <a href="/wiki/S%C3%A3o_Pedro_(Funchal)" title="São Pedro (Funchal)">São Pedro</a>, <a href="/wiki/Funchal" title="Funchal">Funchal</a>, on the Portuguese island of <a href="/wiki/Madeira" title="Madeira">Madeira</a>, and grew up in <a href="/wiki/Santo_Ant%C3%B3nio_(Funchal)" title="Santo António (Funchal)">Santo António</a>, Funchal.<sup id="cite_ref-19" class="reference"><a href="#cite_note-19">&#91;16&#93;</a></sup><sup id="cite_ref-20" class="reference"><a href="#cite_note-20">&#91;17&#93;</a></sup> He is the fourth and youngest child of Maria Dolores dos Santos Viveiros da Aveiro, a cook, and José Dinis Aveiro, a municipal gardener and part-time <a href="/wiki/Equipment_manager" title="Equipment manager">kit man</a>.<sup id="cite_ref-The_little_bee_21-0" class="reference"><a href="#cite_note-The_little_bee-21">&#91;18&#93;</a></sup> His great-grandmother on his father's side, Isabel da Piedade, was from the island of <a href="/wiki/S%C3%A3o_Vicente,_Cape_Verde" title="São Vicente, Cape Verde">São Vicente</a>, <a href="/wiki/Cape_Verde" title="Cape Verde">Cape Verde</a>.<sup id="cite_ref-22" class="reference"><a href="#cite_note-22">&#91;19&#93;</a></sup> He has one older brother, Hugo, and two older sisters, Elma and Liliana Cátia "Katia".<sup id="cite_ref-AtFeet_23-0" class="reference"><a href="#cite_note-AtFeet-23">&#91;20&#93;</a></sup> His mother revealed that she wanted to <a href="/wiki/Abortion" title="Abortion">abort</a> him due to poverty, his father's <a href="/wiki/Alcoholism" title="Alcoholism">alcoholism</a> and having too many children already, but her doctor refused to perform the procedure.<sup id="cite_ref-24" class="reference"><a href="#cite_note-24">&#91;21&#93;</a></sup> Ronaldo grew up in a <a href="/wiki/Catholic_Church_in_Portugal" title="Catholic Church in Portugal">Catholic</a> and impoverished home, sharing a room with all his siblings.<sup id="cite_ref-25" class="reference"><a href="#cite_note-25">&#91;22&#93;</a></sup>
</p><p>As a child, Ronaldo played for <a href="/wiki/CF_Andorinha" title="CF Andorinha">Andorinha</a> from 1992 to 1995,<sup id="cite_ref-26" class="reference"><a href="#cite_note-26">&#91;23&#93;</a></sup> where his father was the kit man,<sup id="cite_ref-The_little_bee_21-1" class="reference"><a href="#cite_note-The_little_bee-21">&#91;18&#93;</a></sup> and later spent two years with <a href="/wiki/C.D._Nacional" title="C.D. Nacional">Nacional</a>. In 1997, aged 12, he went on a three-day trial with <a href="/wiki/Sporting_CP" title="Sporting CP">Sporting CP</a>, who signed him for a fee of £1,500.<sup id="cite_ref-Clash_of_the_Titans_27-0" class="reference"><a href="#cite_note-Clash_of_the_Titans-27">&#91;24&#93;</a></sup> He subsequently moved from Madeira to <a href="/wiki/Alcochete" title="Alcochete">Alcochete</a>, near <a href="/wiki/Lisbon" title="Lisbon">Lisbon</a>, to join Sporting youth <a href="/wiki/Sporting_CP_Youth_Academy" title="Sporting CP Youth Academy">football academy</a>.<sup id="cite_ref-Clash_of_the_Titans_27-1" class="reference"><a href="#cite_note-Clash_of_the_Titans-27">&#91;24&#93;</a></sup> By age 14, Ronaldo believed he had the ability to play semi-professionally, and agreed with his mother to cease his education in order to focus entirely on football.<sup id="cite_ref-expelled_28-0" class="reference"><a href="#cite_note-expelled-28">&#91;25&#93;</a></sup> While popular with other students at school, he had been expelled after throwing a chair at his teacher, who he said had "disrespected" him.<sup id="cite_ref-expelled_28-1" class="reference"><a href="#cite_note-expelled-28">&#91;25&#93;</a></sup> However, one year later, he was diagnosed with a <a href="/wiki/Tachycardia" title="Tachycardia">racing heart</a>, a condition that could have forced him to give up playing football.<sup id="cite_ref-29" class="reference"><a href="#cite_note-29">&#91;26&#93;</a></sup> Ronaldo underwent heart surgery where a laser was used to <a href="/wiki/Cauterization" title="Cauterization">cauterise</a> multiple <a href="/wiki/Electrical_conduction_system_of_the_heart" title="Electrical conduction system of the heart">cardiac pathways</a> into one, altering his <a href="/wiki/Heart_rate" title="Heart rate">resting heart rate</a>.<sup id="cite_ref-30" class="reference"><a href="#cite_note-30">&#91;27&#93;</a></sup> He was discharged from the hospital hours after the procedure and resumed training a few days later.<sup id="cite_ref-31" class="reference"><a href="#cite_note-31">&#91;28&#93;</a></sup><sup id="cite_ref-32" class="reference"><a href="#cite_note-32">&#91;29&#93;</a></sup>
</p>
<h2><span class="mw-headline" id="Club_career">Club career</span></h2>
<h3><span class="mw-headline" id="Sporting_CP">Sporting CP</span></h3>
<div class="thumb tright"><div class="thumbinner" style="width:222px;"><a href="/wiki/File:C.Ronaldo_at_Museum_Mundo_Sporting.JPG" class="image"><img alt="" src="//upload.wikimedia.org/wikipedia/commons/thumb/f/fe/C.Ronaldo_at_Museum_Mundo_Sporting.JPG/220px-C.Ronaldo_at_Museum_Mundo_Sporting.JPG" decoding="async" width="220" height="165" class="thumbimage" srcset="//upload.wikimedia.org/wikipedia/commons/thumb/f/fe/C.Ronaldo_at_Museum_Mundo_Sporting.JPG/330px-C.Ronaldo_at_Museum_Mundo_Sporting.JPG 1.5x, //upload.wikimedia.org/wikipedia/commons/thumb/f/fe/C.Ronaldo_at_Museum_Mundo_Sporting.JPG/440px-C.Ronaldo_at_Museum_Mundo_Sporting.JPG 2x" data-file-width="4608" data-file-height="3456" /></a>  <div class="thumbcaption"><div class="magnify"><a href="/wiki/File:C.Ronaldo_at_Museum_Mundo_Sporting.JPG" class="internal" title="Enlarge"></a></div>Ronaldo memorabilia at Sporting CP's museum</div></div></div>
<p>At age 16, Ronaldo was promoted from Sporting's youth team by first-team manager <a href="/wiki/L%C3%A1szl%C3%B3_B%C3%B6l%C3%B6ni" title="László Bölöni">László Bölöni</a>, who was impressed with his dribbling.<sup id="cite_ref-33" class="reference"><a href="#cite_note-33">&#91;30&#93;</a></sup> He subsequently became the first player to play for the club's under-16, under-17 and under-18 teams, the B team, and the first team, all within a single season.<sup id="cite_ref-Clash_of_the_Titans_27-2" class="reference"><a href="#cite_note-Clash_of_the_Titans-27">&#91;24&#93;</a></sup> A year later, on 7 October 2002, Ronaldo made his debut in the <a href="/wiki/Primeira_Liga" title="Primeira Liga">Primeira Liga</a>, against <a href="/wiki/Moreirense_F.C." title="Moreirense F.C.">Moreirense</a>, and scored two goals in their 3–0 win.<sup id="cite_ref-u17_34-0" class="reference"><a href="#cite_note-u17-34">&#91;31&#93;</a></sup> Over the course of the <a href="/wiki/2002%E2%80%9303_Primeira_Liga" title="2002–03 Primeira Liga">2002–03 season</a>, his representatives suggested the player to <a href="/wiki/Liverpool_F.C." title="Liverpool F.C.">Liverpool</a> manager <a href="/wiki/G%C3%A9rard_Houllier" title="Gérard Houllier">Gérard Houllier</a> and <a href="/wiki/FC_Barcelona" title="FC Barcelona">Barcelona</a> president <a href="/wiki/Joan_Laporta" title="Joan Laporta">Joan Laporta</a>.<sup id="cite_ref-Eurosport_2011_35-0" class="reference"><a href="#cite_note-Eurosport_2011-35">&#91;32&#93;</a></sup> Manager <a href="/wiki/Ars%C3%A8ne_Wenger" title="Arsène Wenger">Arsène Wenger</a>, who was interested in signing the winger, met with him at <a href="/wiki/Arsenal_F.C." title="Arsenal F.C.">Arsenal</a>'s grounds in November to discuss a possible transfer.<sup id="cite_ref-36" class="reference"><a href="#cite_note-36">&#91;33&#93;</a></sup>
</p><p><a href="/wiki/Manchester_United_F.C." title="Manchester United F.C.">Manchester United</a> manager <a href="/wiki/Alex_Ferguson" title="Alex Ferguson">Alex Ferguson</a>, however, was determined to acquire Ronaldo on a permanent move urgently, after Sporting defeated United 3–1 at the inauguration of the <a href="/wiki/Est%C3%A1dio_Jos%C3%A9_Alvalade" title="Estádio José Alvalade">Estádio José Alvalade</a> in August 2003. Initially, United had just planned to sign Ronaldo and then loan him back to Sporting for a year.<sup id="cite_ref-BR2003_37-0" class="reference"><a href="#cite_note-BR2003-37">&#91;34&#93;</a></sup> Having been impressed by him, however, the Manchester United players urged Ferguson to sign him. After the game, Ferguson agreed to pay Sporting £12.24 million<sup id="cite_ref-BR2003_37-1" class="reference"><a href="#cite_note-BR2003-37">&#91;34&#93;</a></sup> for what he considered to be "one of the most exciting young players" he had ever seen.<sup id="cite_ref-38" class="reference"><a href="#cite_note-38">&#91;35&#93;</a></sup> A decade after his departure from the club, in April 2013, Sporting honoured Ronaldo by selecting him to become their 100,000th member.<sup id="cite_ref-39" class="reference"><a href="#cite_note-39">&#91;36&#93;</a></sup>
</p>
<h3><span class="mw-headline" id="Manchester_United">Manchester United</span></h3>
<h4><span id="2003.E2.80.932007:_Development_and_breakthrough"></span><span class="mw-headline" id="2003–2007:_Development_and_breakthrough">2003–2007: Development and breakthrough</span></h4>
<div class="quotebox pullquote floatright" style="width:30%; ;"><style data-mw-deduplicate="TemplateStyles:r1012376600">.mw-parser-output .quotebox{background-color:#F9F9F9;border:1px solid #aaa;box-sizing:border-box;padding:10px;font-size:88%;max-width:100%}.mw-parser-output .quotebox.floatleft{margin:0.5em 1.4em 0.8em 0}.mw-parser-output .quotebox.floatright{margin:0.5em 0 0.8em 1.4em}.mw-parser-output .quotebox.centered{margin:0.5em auto 0.8em auto}.mw-parser-output .quotebox.floatleft p,.mw-parser-output .quotebox.floatright p{font-style:inherit}.mw-parser-output .quotebox-title{background-color:#F9F9F9;text-align:center;font-size:larger;font-weight:bold}.mw-parser-output .quotebox-quote.quoted:before{font-family:"Times New Roman",serif;font-weight:bold;font-size:large;color:gray;content:" “ ";vertical-align:-45%;line-height:0}.mw-parser-output .quotebox-quote.quoted:after{font-family:"Times New Roman",serif;font-weight:bold;font-size:large;color:gray;content:" ” ";line-height:0}.mw-parser-output .quotebox .left-aligned{text-align:left}.mw-parser-output .quotebox .right-aligned{text-align:right}.mw-parser-output .quotebox .center-aligned{text-align:center}.mw-parser-output .quotebox cite{display:block;font-style:normal}@media screen and (max-width:640px){.mw-parser-output .quotebox{width:100%!important;margin:0 0 0.8em!important;float:none!important}}</style>
<div class="quotebox-quote left-aligned" style="">"There have been a few players described as 'the new George Best' over the years, but this is the first time it's been a compliment to me."</div>
<p><cite class="left-aligned" style="">—Former Manchester United player <a href="/wiki/George_Best" title="George Best">George Best</a> hails the 18-year-old Cristiano Ronaldo in 2003.<sup id="cite_ref-BestQuote_40-0" class="reference"><a href="#cite_note-BestQuote-40">&#91;37&#93;</a></sup></cite>
</p>
</div>
<p>Ronaldo became Manchester United's first Portuguese player when he signed before the <a href="/wiki/2003%E2%80%9304_FA_Premier_League" title="2003–04 FA Premier League">2003–04 season</a>.<sup id="cite_ref-41" class="reference"><a href="#cite_note-41">&#91;38&#93;</a></sup> His transfer fee of £12.24&#160;million made him, at the time, the most expensive teenager in English football history.<sup id="cite_ref-42" class="reference"><a href="#cite_note-42">&#91;39&#93;</a></sup> Although he requested the number 28, his number at Sporting, he received the <a href="/wiki/Squad_number_(association_football)" title="Squad number (association football)">number 7 shirt</a>, which had previously been worn by such United players as <a href="/wiki/George_Best" title="George Best">George Best</a>, <a href="/wiki/Eric_Cantona" title="Eric Cantona">Eric Cantona</a> and <a href="/wiki/David_Beckham" title="David Beckham">David Beckham</a>.<sup id="cite_ref-43" class="reference"><a href="#cite_note-43">&#91;40&#93;</a></sup> Wearing the number 7 became an extra source of motivation for Ronaldo.<sup id="cite_ref-Legends_44-0" class="reference"><a href="#cite_note-Legends-44">&#91;41&#93;</a></sup> A key element in his development during his time in England proved to be his manager, Alex Ferguson, of whom he later said, "He's been my father in sport, one of the most important and influential factors in my career."<sup id="cite_ref-45" class="reference"><a href="#cite_note-45">&#91;42&#93;</a></sup>
</p>
<div class="thumb tleft"><div class="thumbinner" style="width:222px;"><a href="/wiki/File:Ronaldo_-_Manchester_United_vs_Chelsea.jpg" class="image"><img alt="" src="//upload.wikimedia.org/wikipedia/commons/thumb/0/00/Ronaldo_-_Manchester_United_vs_Chelsea.jpg/220px-Ronaldo_-_Manchester_United_vs_Chelsea.jpg" decoding="async" width="220" height="165" class="thumbimage" srcset="//upload.wikimedia.org/wikipedia/commons/thumb/0/00/Ronaldo_-_Manchester_United_vs_Chelsea.jpg/330px-Ronaldo_-_Manchester_United_vs_Chelsea.jpg 1.5x, //upload.wikimedia.org/wikipedia/commons/thumb/0/00/Ronaldo_-_Manchester_United_vs_Chelsea.jpg/440px-Ronaldo_-_Manchester_United_vs_Chelsea.jpg 2x" data-file-width="1024" data-file-height="768" /></a>  <div class="thumbcaption"><div class="magnify"><a href="/wiki/File:Ronaldo_-_Manchester_United_vs_Chelsea.jpg" class="internal" title="Enlarge"></a></div>Ronaldo playing for Manchester United against <a href="/wiki/Chelsea_F.C." title="Chelsea F.C.">Chelsea</a> in the <a href="/wiki/2005%E2%80%9306_FA_Premier_League" title="2005–06 FA Premier League">2005–06 Premier League</a> season</div></div></div>
<p>Ronaldo made his debut in the <a href="/wiki/Premier_League" title="Premier League">Premier League</a> in a 4–0 home victory over <a href="/wiki/Bolton_Wanderers_F.C." title="Bolton Wanderers F.C.">Bolton Wanderers</a> on 16 August 2003, receiving a standing ovation when he came on as a substitute.<sup id="cite_ref-46" class="reference"><a href="#cite_note-46">&#91;43&#93;</a></sup> His performance earned praise from George Best, who hailed it as "undoubtedly the most exciting debut" he had ever seen.<sup id="cite_ref-BestQuote_40-1" class="reference"><a href="#cite_note-BestQuote-40">&#91;37&#93;</a></sup> Ronaldo scored his first goal for Manchester United with a free-kick in a 3–0 win over <a href="/wiki/Portsmouth_F.C." title="Portsmouth F.C.">Portsmouth</a> on 1 November.<sup id="cite_ref-47" class="reference"><a href="#cite_note-47">&#91;44&#93;</a></sup> Three other league goals followed in the second half of the campaign,<sup id="cite_ref-48" class="reference"><a href="#cite_note-48">&#91;45&#93;</a></sup> the last of which came against <a href="/wiki/Aston_Villa_F.C." title="Aston Villa F.C.">Aston Villa</a> on the final day of the season, a match in which he also received his first <a href="/wiki/Penalty_card" title="Penalty card">red card</a>.<sup id="cite_ref-49" class="reference"><a href="#cite_note-49">&#91;46&#93;</a></sup> Ronaldo ended his first season in English football by scoring the opening goal in United's 3–0 victory over <a href="/wiki/Millwall_F.C." title="Millwall F.C.">Millwall</a> in the <a href="/wiki/2004_FA_Cup_Final" title="2004 FA Cup Final">FA Cup final</a>, earning his first trophy.<sup id="cite_ref-50" class="reference"><a href="#cite_note-50">&#91;47&#93;</a></sup> BBC pundit <a href="/wiki/Alan_Hansen" title="Alan Hansen">Alan Hansen</a> described him as the star of the final.<sup id="cite_ref-HansenQuote_51-0" class="reference"><a href="#cite_note-HansenQuote-51">&#91;48&#93;</a></sup> The British press had been critical of Ronaldo during the season for his "elaborate" step-overs in trying to beat a man,<sup id="cite_ref-52" class="reference"><a href="#cite_note-52">&#91;49&#93;</a></sup> but teammate <a href="/wiki/Gary_Neville" title="Gary Neville">Gary Neville</a> said he was "not a show pony, but the real thing", and predicted he would become a world class player.<sup id="cite_ref-53" class="reference"><a href="#cite_note-53">&#91;50&#93;</a></sup>
</p>
<div class="quotebox pullquote floatright" style="width:27%; ;"><link rel="mw-deduplicated-inline-style" href="mw-data:TemplateStyles:r1012376600"/>
<div class="quotebox-quote left-aligned" style="">"He has got the tricks and party pieces, we know that, but they're not much good unless there is something at the end of it all. We still have to remember, of course, that the lad is only 19 years of age. Considering that, you have to say he has got massive talent. His feet are mesmerising at times, and if he can couple that with some consistently good crossing, the future looks frightening."</div>
<p><cite class="left-aligned" style="">—Former <a href="/wiki/BBC" title="BBC">BBC</a> pundit <a href="/wiki/Alan_Hansen" title="Alan Hansen">Alan Hansen</a> critiquing Ronaldo after his first season.<sup id="cite_ref-HansenQuote_51-1" class="reference"><a href="#cite_note-HansenQuote-51">&#91;48&#93;</a></sup></cite>
</p>
</div>
<p>At the start of 2005, Ronaldo played two of his best matches of the <a href="/wiki/2004%E2%80%9305_FA_Premier_League" title="2004–05 FA Premier League">2004–05 season</a>, producing a goal and an assist against Aston Villa and scoring twice against <a href="/wiki/Arsenal_F.C.%E2%80%93Manchester_United_F.C._rivalry" title="Arsenal F.C.–Manchester United F.C. rivalry">rivals</a> Arsenal.<sup id="cite_ref-54" class="reference"><a href="#cite_note-54">&#91;51&#93;</a></sup><sup id="cite_ref-55" class="reference"><a href="#cite_note-55">&#91;52&#93;</a></sup> He played the full 120 minutes of the decisive match against Arsenal in the <a href="/wiki/2005_FA_Cup_Final" title="2005 FA Cup Final">FA Cup final</a>, which ended in a goalless draw, and scored his attempt in the lost <a href="/wiki/Penalty_shoot-out_(association_football)" title="Penalty shoot-out (association football)">penalty shoot-out</a>.<sup id="cite_ref-56" class="reference"><a href="#cite_note-56">&#91;53&#93;</a></sup> He scored Manchester United's 1000th Premier League goal on 29 October, their only strike in a 4–1 loss to <a href="/wiki/Middlesbrough_F.C." title="Middlesbrough F.C.">Middlesbrough</a>.<sup id="cite_ref-57" class="reference"><a href="#cite_note-57">&#91;54&#93;</a></sup> Midway through the season, in November, he signed a new contract which extended his previous deal by two years to 2010.<sup id="cite_ref-58" class="reference"><a href="#cite_note-58">&#91;55&#93;</a></sup> Ronaldo won his second trophy in English football, the <a href="/wiki/2005%E2%80%9306_Football_League_Cup" title="2005–06 Football League Cup">Football League Cup</a>, after scoring the third goal in United's 4–0 final victory over <a href="/wiki/Wigan_Athletic_F.C." title="Wigan Athletic F.C.">Wigan Athletic</a>.<sup id="cite_ref-59" class="reference"><a href="#cite_note-59">&#91;56&#93;</a></sup>
</p><p>During his third season in England, Ronaldo was involved in several incidents. He had a one-match ban imposed on him by <a href="/wiki/UEFA" title="UEFA">UEFA</a> for a "<a href="/wiki/The_finger" title="The finger">one-fingered gesture</a>" towards <a href="/wiki/S.L._Benfica" title="S.L. Benfica">Benfica</a> fans,<sup id="cite_ref-60" class="reference"><a href="#cite_note-60">&#91;57&#93;</a></sup> and was sent off in the <a href="/wiki/Manchester_derby" title="Manchester derby">Manchester derby</a> (a 3–1 defeat) for kicking <a href="/wiki/Manchester_City_F.C." title="Manchester City F.C.">Manchester City</a>'s former United player <a href="/wiki/Andy_Cole" title="Andy Cole">Andy Cole</a>.<sup id="cite_ref-61" class="reference"><a href="#cite_note-61">&#91;58&#93;</a></sup> Ronaldo clashed with a teammate, striker <a href="/wiki/Ruud_van_Nistelrooy" title="Ruud van Nistelrooy">Ruud van Nistelrooy</a>, who took offence at the winger's showboating style of play.<sup id="cite_ref-62" class="reference"><a href="#cite_note-62">&#91;59&#93;</a></sup> Following the <a href="/wiki/2006_FIFA_World_Cup" title="2006 FIFA World Cup">2006 FIFA World Cup</a>, in which he was involved in an incident where club teammate <a href="/wiki/Wayne_Rooney" title="Wayne Rooney">Wayne Rooney</a> was sent off,<sup id="cite_ref-63" class="reference"><a href="#cite_note-63">&#91;60&#93;</a></sup> Ronaldo publicly asked for a transfer, lamenting the lack of support he felt he had received from the club over the incident.<sup id="cite_ref-64" class="reference"><a href="#cite_note-64">&#91;61&#93;</a></sup> United, however, denied the possibility of him leaving the club.<sup id="cite_ref-65" class="reference"><a href="#cite_note-65">&#91;62&#93;</a></sup>
</p><p>Although his World Cup altercation with Rooney resulted in Ronaldo being booed throughout the <a href="/wiki/2006%E2%80%9307_FA_Premier_League" title="2006–07 FA Premier League">2006–07 season</a>,<sup id="cite_ref-66" class="reference"><a href="#cite_note-66">&#91;63&#93;</a></sup> it proved to be his breakout year, as he broke the 20-goal barrier for the first time and won his first <a href="/wiki/List_of_English_football_champions" title="List of English football champions">Premier League title</a>. An important factor in this success was his one-to-one training by first-team coach <a href="/wiki/Ren%C3%A9_Meulensteen" title="René Meulensteen">René Meulensteen</a>, who taught him to make himself more unpredictable, improve his teamwork, call for the ball, and capitalise on goalscoring opportunities rather than waiting for the chance to score the aesthetically pleasing goals for which he was already known.<sup id="cite_ref-67" class="reference"><a href="#cite_note-67">&#91;64&#93;</a></sup> He scored three consecutive braces at the end of December, against Aston Villa (a victory that put United on top of the league), Wigan Athletic and <a href="/wiki/Reading_F.C." title="Reading F.C.">Reading</a>.<sup id="cite_ref-68" class="reference"><a href="#cite_note-68">&#91;65&#93;</a></sup><sup id="cite_ref-69" class="reference"><a href="#cite_note-69">&#91;66&#93;</a></sup><sup id="cite_ref-70" class="reference"><a href="#cite_note-70">&#91;67&#93;</a></sup> Ronaldo was named the <a href="/wiki/FA_Premier_League_Player_of_the_Month" class="mw-redirect" title="FA Premier League Player of the Month">Premier League Player of the Month</a> in November and December, becoming only the third player to receive consecutive honours.<sup id="cite_ref-71" class="reference"><a href="#cite_note-71">&#91;68&#93;</a></sup><sup id="cite_ref-72" class="reference"><a href="#cite_note-72">&#91;69&#93;</a></sup>
</p>
<h4><span id="2007.E2.80.932008:_Collective_and_individual_success"></span><span class="mw-headline" id="2007–2008:_Collective_and_individual_success">2007–2008: Collective and individual success</span></h4>
<div class="thumb tright"><div class="thumbinner" style="width:262px;"><a href="/wiki/File:Cristiano_Ronaldo.jpg" class="image"><img alt="" src="//upload.wikimedia.org/wikipedia/commons/thumb/3/3c/Cristiano_Ronaldo.jpg/260px-Cristiano_Ronaldo.jpg" decoding="async" width="260" height="173" class="thumbimage" srcset="//upload.wikimedia.org/wikipedia/commons/thumb/3/3c/Cristiano_Ronaldo.jpg/390px-Cristiano_Ronaldo.jpg 1.5x, //upload.wikimedia.org/wikipedia/commons/thumb/3/3c/Cristiano_Ronaldo.jpg/520px-Cristiano_Ronaldo.jpg 2x" data-file-width="3888" data-file-height="2592" /></a>  <div class="thumbcaption"><div class="magnify"><a href="/wiki/File:Cristiano_Ronaldo.jpg" class="internal" title="Enlarge"></a></div>Ronaldo during a game in the <a href="/wiki/2006%E2%80%9307_FA_Premier_League" title="2006–07 FA Premier League">2006–07 Premier League</a> season</div></div></div>
<p>At the quarter-final stage of the <a href="/wiki/2006%E2%80%9307_UEFA_Champions_League" title="2006–07 UEFA Champions League">2006–07 UEFA Champions League</a>, Ronaldo scored his first goals in his 30th match in the competition,<sup id="cite_ref-73" class="reference"><a href="#cite_note-73">&#91;70&#93;</a></sup> finding the net twice in a 7–1 victory over <a href="/wiki/A.S._Roma" title="A.S. Roma">Roma</a>.<sup id="cite_ref-74" class="reference"><a href="#cite_note-74">&#91;71&#93;</a></sup> He subsequently scored four minutes into the first semi-final leg against <a href="/wiki/A.C._Milan" title="A.C. Milan">Milan</a>, which ended in a 3–2 win,<sup id="cite_ref-75" class="reference"><a href="#cite_note-75">&#91;72&#93;</a></sup> but was <a href="/wiki/Marking_(association_football)" title="Marking (association football)">marked</a> out of the second leg as United lost 3–0 at the <a href="/wiki/San_Siro" title="San Siro">San Siro</a>.<sup id="cite_ref-76" class="reference"><a href="#cite_note-76">&#91;73&#93;</a></sup> He also helped United reach the <a href="/wiki/2007_FA_Cup_Final" title="2007 FA Cup Final">FA Cup final</a>, but the decisive match against <a href="/wiki/Chelsea_F.C." title="Chelsea F.C.">Chelsea</a> ended in a 1–0 defeat.<sup id="cite_ref-77" class="reference"><a href="#cite_note-77">&#91;74&#93;</a></sup> Ronaldo scored the only goal in the Manchester derby on 5 May 2007 (his 50th goal for the club), as Manchester United claimed their first Premier League title in four years.<sup id="cite_ref-78" class="reference"><a href="#cite_note-78">&#91;75&#93;</a></sup> As a result of his performances, he amassed a host of personal awards for the season. He won the <a href="/wiki/Professional_Footballers%27_Association" title="Professional Footballers&#39; Association">Professional Footballers' Association</a>'s <a href="/wiki/PFA_Players%27_Player_of_the_Year" title="PFA Players&#39; Player of the Year">Player's Player</a>, <a href="/wiki/PFA_Fans%27_Player_of_the_Year" title="PFA Fans&#39; Player of the Year">Fans' Player</a>, and <a href="/wiki/PFA_Young_Player_of_the_Year" title="PFA Young Player of the Year">Young Player of the Year</a> awards, as well as the <a href="/wiki/Football_Writers%27_Association" title="Football Writers&#39; Association">Football Writers' Association</a>'s <a href="/wiki/FWA_Footballer_of_the_Year" title="FWA Footballer of the Year">Footballer of the Year</a> award,<sup id="cite_ref-79" class="reference"><a href="#cite_note-79">&#91;76&#93;</a></sup><sup id="cite_ref-80" class="reference"><a href="#cite_note-80">&#91;77&#93;</a></sup> becoming the first player to win all four main PFA and FWA honours.<sup id="cite_ref-PFA0607_81-0" class="reference"><a href="#cite_note-PFA0607-81">&#91;78&#93;</a></sup> His club wages were concurrently upgraded to £120,000 a week (£31&#160;million total) as part of a five-year contract extension with United.<sup id="cite_ref-82" class="reference"><a href="#cite_note-82">&#91;79&#93;</a></sup> At the end of 2007, Ronaldo was named runner-up to <a href="/wiki/Kak%C3%A1" title="Kaká">Kaká</a> for the <a href="/wiki/Ballon_d%27Or" title="Ballon d&#39;Or">Ballon d'Or</a>,<sup id="cite_ref-83" class="reference"><a href="#cite_note-83">&#91;80&#93;</a></sup> and came third, behind Kaká and <a href="/wiki/Lionel_Messi" title="Lionel Messi">Lionel Messi</a>, in the running for the <a href="/wiki/FIFA_World_Player_of_the_Year" title="FIFA World Player of the Year">FIFA World Player of the Year</a> award.<sup id="cite_ref-84" class="reference"><a href="#cite_note-84">&#91;81&#93;</a></sup>
</p><p>Ronaldo scored his first and only <a href="/wiki/Hat-trick_(association_football)" class="mw-redirect" title="Hat-trick (association football)">hat-trick</a> for Manchester United in a 6–0 win against <a href="/wiki/Newcastle_United_F.C." title="Newcastle United F.C.">Newcastle United</a> on 12 January 2008, bringing United up to the top of the Premier League table.<sup id="cite_ref-85" class="reference"><a href="#cite_note-85">&#91;82&#93;</a></sup> A month later, on 19 March, he captained United for the first time in a home win over Bolton, and scored both goals of the match.<sup id="cite_ref-86" class="reference"><a href="#cite_note-86">&#91;83&#93;</a></sup> His second goal was his 33rd of the campaign, which bettered George Best's total of 32 goals in the 1967–68 season, thus setting the club's new single-season record by a midfielder.<sup id="cite_ref-87" class="reference"><a href="#cite_note-87">&#91;84&#93;</a></sup> His 31 league goals earned him the <a href="/wiki/Premier_League_Golden_Boot" title="Premier League Golden Boot">Premier League Golden Boot</a>,<sup id="cite_ref-88" class="reference"><a href="#cite_note-88">&#91;85&#93;</a></sup> as well as the <a href="/wiki/European_Golden_Shoe" title="European Golden Shoe">European Golden Shoe</a>, which made him the first winger to win the latter award.<sup id="cite_ref-89" class="reference"><a href="#cite_note-89">&#91;86&#93;</a></sup> He additionally received the PFA Players' Player of the Year and FWA Footballer of the Year awards for the second consecutive season.<sup id="cite_ref-PFA0708_90-0" class="reference"><a href="#cite_note-PFA0708-90">&#91;87&#93;</a></sup><sup id="cite_ref-91" class="reference"><a href="#cite_note-91">&#91;88&#93;</a></sup>
</p><p>In the knockout stage of the Champions League, Ronaldo scored the decisive goal against <a href="/wiki/Olympique_Lyonnais" title="Olympique Lyonnais">Lyon</a>, which helped United advance to the quarter-finals 2–1 on aggregate,<sup id="cite_ref-92" class="reference"><a href="#cite_note-92">&#91;89&#93;</a></sup> and, while playing as a striker, scored with a header in the 3–0 aggregate victory over Roma.<sup id="cite_ref-93" class="reference"><a href="#cite_note-93">&#91;90&#93;</a></sup> United advanced to the <a href="/wiki/2008_UEFA_Champions_League_Final" title="2008 UEFA Champions League Final">final</a> against Chelsea in Moscow, where, despite his opening goal being negated by an equaliser and his penalty being saved in the shoot-out,<sup id="cite_ref-94" class="reference"><a href="#cite_note-94">&#91;91&#93;</a></sup> Manchester United emerged victorious.<sup id="cite_ref-95" class="reference"><a href="#cite_note-95">&#91;92&#93;</a></sup> As the <a href="/wiki/List_of_European_Cup_and_UEFA_Champions_League_top_scorers" class="mw-redirect" title="List of European Cup and UEFA Champions League top scorers">Champions League top scorer</a>, Ronaldo was named the <a href="/wiki/UEFA_Club_Footballer_of_the_Year" title="UEFA Club Footballer of the Year">UEFA Club Footballer of the Year</a>.<sup id="cite_ref-UEFA-Profile_96-0" class="reference"><a href="#cite_note-UEFA-Profile-96">&#91;93&#93;</a></sup>
</p><p>Ronaldo scored a total of 42 goals in all competitions during the <a href="/wiki/2007%E2%80%9308_FA_Premier_League" class="mw-redirect" title="2007–08 FA Premier League">2007–08 season</a>, his most prolific campaign during his time in England. He missed three matches after headbutting a <a href="/wiki/Portsmouth_F.C." title="Portsmouth F.C.">Portsmouth</a> player at the start of the season, an experience he said taught him not to let opponents provoke him.<sup id="cite_ref-97" class="reference"><a href="#cite_note-97">&#91;94&#93;</a></sup> As rumours circulated of Ronaldo's interest in moving to <a href="/wiki/Real_Madrid_CF" title="Real Madrid CF">Real Madrid</a>, United filed a tampering complaint with governing body FIFA over Madrid's alleged pursuit of their player, but they declined to take action.<sup id="cite_ref-98" class="reference"><a href="#cite_note-98">&#91;95&#93;</a></sup> FIFA president <a href="/wiki/Sepp_Blatter" title="Sepp Blatter">Sepp Blatter</a> asserted that the player should be allowed to leave his club, describing the situation as "modern slavery".<sup id="cite_ref-99" class="reference"><a href="#cite_note-99">&#91;96&#93;</a></sup> Despite Ronaldo publicly agreeing with Blatter,<sup id="cite_ref-100" class="reference"><a href="#cite_note-100">&#91;97&#93;</a></sup> he remained at United for another year.<sup id="cite_ref-101" class="reference"><a href="#cite_note-101">&#91;98&#93;</a></sup>
</p>
<h4><span id="2008.E2.80.932009:_Final_season_and_continued_success"></span><span class="mw-headline" id="2008–2009:_Final_season_and_continued_success">2008–2009: Final season and continued success</span></h4>
<div class="thumb tleft"><div class="thumbinner" style="width:222px;"><a href="/wiki/File:2009-3-14_ManUtd_vs_LFC_Ronaldo_Tackling.JPG" class="image"><img alt="" src="//upload.wikimedia.org/wikipedia/commons/thumb/c/cf/2009-3-14_ManUtd_vs_LFC_Ronaldo_Tackling.JPG/220px-2009-3-14_ManUtd_vs_LFC_Ronaldo_Tackling.JPG" decoding="async" width="220" height="146" class="thumbimage" srcset="//upload.wikimedia.org/wikipedia/commons/thumb/c/cf/2009-3-14_ManUtd_vs_LFC_Ronaldo_Tackling.JPG/330px-2009-3-14_ManUtd_vs_LFC_Ronaldo_Tackling.JPG 1.5x, //upload.wikimedia.org/wikipedia/commons/thumb/c/cf/2009-3-14_ManUtd_vs_LFC_Ronaldo_Tackling.JPG/440px-2009-3-14_ManUtd_vs_LFC_Ronaldo_Tackling.JPG 2x" data-file-width="3008" data-file-height="2000" /></a>  <div class="thumbcaption"><div class="magnify"><a href="/wiki/File:2009-3-14_ManUtd_vs_LFC_Ronaldo_Tackling.JPG" class="internal" title="Enlarge"></a></div>Ronaldo in his final season with Manchester United playing in a Premier League game against <a href="/wiki/Liverpool_F.C." title="Liverpool F.C.">Liverpool</a></div></div></div>
<p>Ahead of the <a href="/wiki/2008%E2%80%9309_FA_Premier_League" class="mw-redirect" title="2008–09 FA Premier League">2008–09 season</a>, on 7 July, Ronaldo underwent ankle surgery,<sup id="cite_ref-102" class="reference"><a href="#cite_note-102">&#91;99&#93;</a></sup> which kept him out of action for 10 weeks.<sup id="cite_ref-103" class="reference"><a href="#cite_note-103">&#91;100&#93;</a></sup> Following his return, he scored his 100th goal in all competitions for United with the first of two free kicks in a 5–0 win against <a href="/wiki/Stoke_City_F.C." title="Stoke City F.C.">Stoke City</a> on 15 November,<sup id="cite_ref-104" class="reference"><a href="#cite_note-104">&#91;101&#93;</a></sup> which meant he had now scored against all 19 opposition teams in the Premier League at the time.<sup id="cite_ref-105" class="reference"><a href="#cite_note-105">&#91;102&#93;</a></sup> At the close of 2008, Ronaldo helped United win the <a href="/wiki/2008_FIFA_Club_World_Cup" title="2008 FIFA Club World Cup">FIFA Club World Cup</a> in Japan,<sup id="cite_ref-106" class="reference"><a href="#cite_note-106">&#91;103&#93;</a></sup> assisting the <a href="/wiki/2008_FIFA_Club_World_Cup_Final" title="2008 FIFA Club World Cup Final">final</a>-winning goal against <a href="/wiki/LDU_Quito" class="mw-redirect" title="LDU Quito">Liga de Quito</a> and winning the <a href="/wiki/List_of_FIFA_Club_World_Cup_awards#Golden_Ball" class="mw-redirect" title="List of FIFA Club World Cup awards">Silver Ball</a> in the process.<sup id="cite_ref-107" class="reference"><a href="#cite_note-107">&#91;104&#93;</a></sup> He subsequently became United's first <a href="/wiki/2008_Ballon_d%27Or" title="2008 Ballon d&#39;Or">Ballon d'Or</a> winner since George Best in 1968,<sup id="cite_ref-108" class="reference"><a href="#cite_note-108">&#91;105&#93;</a></sup> and the first Premier League player to be named the <a href="/wiki/2008_FIFA_World_Player_of_the_Year" title="2008 FIFA World Player of the Year">FIFA World Player of the Year</a>.<sup id="cite_ref-109" class="reference"><a href="#cite_note-109">&#91;106&#93;</a></sup>
</p><p>His match-winning goal in the second leg against <a href="/wiki/FC_Porto" title="FC Porto">Porto</a>, a 40-yard strike, earned him the inaugural <a href="/wiki/FIFA_Pusk%C3%A1s_Award" title="FIFA Puskás Award">FIFA Puskás Award</a>, presented by FIFA in recognition of the best goal of the year;<sup id="cite_ref-110" class="reference"><a href="#cite_note-110">&#91;107&#93;</a></sup> he later called it the best goal he had ever scored.<sup id="cite_ref-111" class="reference"><a href="#cite_note-111">&#91;108&#93;</a></sup> United advanced to the <a href="/wiki/2009_UEFA_Champions_League_Final" title="2009 UEFA Champions League Final">final</a> in Rome,<sup id="cite_ref-112" class="reference"><a href="#cite_note-112">&#91;109&#93;</a></sup> where he made little impact in United's 2–0 defeat to Barcelona.<sup id="cite_ref-113" class="reference"><a href="#cite_note-113">&#91;110&#93;</a></sup> Ronaldo ended his time in England with nine trophies, as United claimed their third successive Premier League title and a <a href="/wiki/2008%E2%80%9309_Football_League_Cup" title="2008–09 Football League Cup">Football League Cup</a>.<sup id="cite_ref-114" class="reference"><a href="#cite_note-114">&#91;111&#93;</a></sup><sup id="cite_ref-115" class="reference"><a href="#cite_note-115">&#91;112&#93;</a></sup> He finished the campaign with 26 goals in all competitions, 16 goals fewer than the previous season, in four more appearances.<sup id="cite_ref-116" class="reference"><a href="#cite_note-116">&#91;113&#93;</a></sup> His final goal for Manchester United came on 10 May 2009 with a free kick in the Manchester derby at <a href="/wiki/Old_Trafford" title="Old Trafford">Old Trafford</a>.<sup id="cite_ref-117" class="reference"><a href="#cite_note-117">&#91;114&#93;</a></sup>
</p>
<h3><span class="mw-headline" id="Real_Madrid">Real Madrid</span></h3>
<h4><span id="2009.E2.80.932013:_World_record_transfer_and_La_Liga_championship"></span><span class="mw-headline" id="2009–2013:_World_record_transfer_and_La_Liga_championship">2009–2013: World record transfer and La Liga championship</span></h4>
<div class="thumb tright"><div class="thumbinner" style="width:172px;"><a href="/wiki/File:Cristiano_Ronaldo_Madrid.jpg" class="image"><img alt="" src="//upload.wikimedia.org/wikipedia/commons/thumb/3/3f/Cristiano_Ronaldo_Madrid.jpg/170px-Cristiano_Ronaldo_Madrid.jpg" decoding="async" width="170" height="273" class="thumbimage" srcset="//upload.wikimedia.org/wikipedia/commons/thumb/3/3f/Cristiano_Ronaldo_Madrid.jpg/255px-Cristiano_Ronaldo_Madrid.jpg 1.5x, //upload.wikimedia.org/wikipedia/commons/thumb/3/3f/Cristiano_Ronaldo_Madrid.jpg/340px-Cristiano_Ronaldo_Madrid.jpg 2x" data-file-width="1490" data-file-height="2394" /></a>  <div class="thumbcaption"><div class="magnify"><a href="/wiki/File:Cristiano_Ronaldo_Madrid.jpg" class="internal" title="Enlarge"></a></div>As his usual number 7 was unavailable, Ronaldo wore number 9 during his <a href="/wiki/2009%E2%80%9310_La_Liga" title="2009–10 La Liga">debut season</a> at Madrid. After <a href="/wiki/Ra%C3%BAl_(footballer)" title="Raúl (footballer)">Raúl</a> departed the club, Ronaldo was handed the number 7 shirt before the <a href="/wiki/2010%E2%80%9311_La_Liga" title="2010–11 La Liga">2010–11 season</a>.</div></div></div>
<p>Ahead of the <a href="/wiki/2009%E2%80%9310_La_Liga" title="2009–10 La Liga">2009–10 season</a>, Ronaldo joined Real Madrid for a <a href="/wiki/World_football_transfer_record" class="mw-redirect" title="World football transfer record">world record transfer fee</a> at the time, of £80&#160;million (€94&#160;million).<sup id="cite_ref-118" class="reference"><a href="#cite_note-118">&#91;115&#93;</a></sup> His contract, which ran until 2015, was worth €11&#160;million per year and contained a €1&#160;billion buy-out clause.<sup id="cite_ref-119" class="reference"><a href="#cite_note-119">&#91;116&#93;</a></sup> At least 80,000 fans attended his presentation at the <a href="/wiki/Santiago_Bernab%C3%A9u_Stadium" title="Santiago Bernabéu Stadium">Santiago Bernabéu</a>, surpassing the 25-year record of 75,000 fans who had welcomed <a href="/wiki/Diego_Maradona" title="Diego Maradona">Diego Maradona</a> at <a href="/wiki/S.S.C._Napoli" title="S.S.C. Napoli">Napoli</a>.<sup id="cite_ref-120" class="reference"><a href="#cite_note-120">&#91;117&#93;</a></sup> Since club captain <a href="/wiki/Ra%C3%BAl_(footballer)" title="Raúl (footballer)">Raúl</a> already wore the number 7 (the number Ronaldo wore at Manchester United), Ronaldo received the number 9 shirt,<sup id="cite_ref-121" class="reference"><a href="#cite_note-121">&#91;118&#93;</a></sup> which was presented to him by former Madrid player <a href="/wiki/Alfredo_Di_St%C3%A9fano" title="Alfredo Di Stéfano">Alfredo Di Stéfano</a>.<sup id="cite_ref-122" class="reference"><a href="#cite_note-122">&#91;119&#93;</a></sup>
</p><p>Ronaldo made his debut in <a href="/wiki/La_Liga" title="La Liga">La Liga</a> on 29 August 2009, against <a href="/wiki/Deportivo_de_La_Coru%C3%B1a" title="Deportivo de La Coruña">Deportivo La Coruña</a>, and scored from the penalty spot in Madrid's 3–2 home win.<sup id="cite_ref-123" class="reference"><a href="#cite_note-123">&#91;120&#93;</a></sup> He scored in each of his first four league fixtures with the club, the first Madrid player to do so.<sup id="cite_ref-124" class="reference"><a href="#cite_note-124">&#91;121&#93;</a></sup> His first Champions League goals for the club followed with two free kicks in the first group match against <a href="/wiki/FC_Z%C3%BCrich" title="FC Zürich">Zürich</a>.<sup id="cite_ref-125" class="reference"><a href="#cite_note-125">&#91;122&#93;</a></sup> His strong start to the season, however, was interrupted when he suffered an ankle injury in October while on international duty, which kept him sidelined for seven weeks.<sup id="cite_ref-126" class="reference"><a href="#cite_note-126">&#91;123&#93;</a></sup><sup id="cite_ref-127" class="reference"><a href="#cite_note-127">&#91;124&#93;</a></sup> A week after his return, he received his first red card in Spain in a match against <a href="/wiki/UD_Almer%C3%ADa" title="UD Almería">Almería</a>.<sup id="cite_ref-128" class="reference"><a href="#cite_note-128">&#91;125&#93;</a></sup> Midway through the season, Ronaldo placed second in the running for the <a href="/wiki/2009_Ballon_d%27Or" title="2009 Ballon d&#39;Or">Ballon d'Or</a> and the <a href="/wiki/2009_FIFA_World_Player_of_the_Year" title="2009 FIFA World Player of the Year">FIFA World Player of the Year</a> award, behind Lionel Messi of <a href="/wiki/FC_Barcelona" title="FC Barcelona">Barcelona</a>, Madrid's historic rivals. He finished the campaign with 33 goals in all competitions, including a hat-trick in a 4–1 win against <a href="/wiki/RCD_Mallorca" title="RCD Mallorca">Mallorca</a> on 5 May 2010, his first in the Spanish competition.<sup id="cite_ref-129" class="reference"><a href="#cite_note-129">&#91;126&#93;</a></sup><sup id="cite_ref-130" class="reference"><a href="#cite_note-130">&#91;127&#93;</a></sup> His first season at Real Madrid ended trophyless.<sup id="cite_ref-131" class="reference"><a href="#cite_note-131">&#91;128&#93;</a></sup>
</p><p>Following Raúl's departure, Ronaldo was handed the number 7 shirt for Real Madrid before the <a href="/wiki/2010%E2%80%9311_La_Liga" title="2010–11 La Liga">2010–11 season</a>.<sup id="cite_ref-Raul_132-0" class="reference"><a href="#cite_note-Raul-132">&#91;129&#93;</a></sup> His subsequent return to his Ballon d'Or-winning form was epitomised when, for the first time in his career, he scored four goals in a single match during a 6–1 rout against <a href="/wiki/Racing_de_Santander" title="Racing de Santander">Racing Santander</a> on 23 October.<sup id="cite_ref-133" class="reference"><a href="#cite_note-133">&#91;130&#93;</a></sup> His haul concluded a goalscoring run of six consecutive matches (three in La Liga, one in the Champions League, and two for Portugal) totalling 11 goals, the most he had scored in a single month. Ronaldo subsequently scored further hat-tricks against <a href="/wiki/Athletic_Bilbao" title="Athletic Bilbao">Athletic Bilbao</a>, <a href="/wiki/Levante_UD" title="Levante UD">Levante</a>, <a href="/wiki/Villarreal_CF" title="Villarreal CF">Villarreal</a>, and <a href="/wiki/M%C3%A1laga_CF" title="Málaga CF">Málaga</a>.<sup id="cite_ref-134" class="reference"><a href="#cite_note-134">&#91;131&#93;</a></sup><sup id="cite_ref-135" class="reference"><a href="#cite_note-135">&#91;132&#93;</a></sup><sup id="cite_ref-136" class="reference"><a href="#cite_note-136">&#91;133&#93;</a></sup> Despite his performance, he did not make the podium for the inaugural <a href="/wiki/FIFA_Ballon_d%27Or" title="FIFA Ballon d&#39;Or">FIFA Ballon d'Or</a> at the end of 2010.<sup id="cite_ref-137" class="reference"><a href="#cite_note-137">&#91;134&#93;</a></sup>
</p><p>During a historical series of four <i><a href="/wiki/El_Cl%C3%A1sico" title="El Clásico">Clásicos</a></i> against rivals Barcelona in April 2011, Ronaldo scored twice to equal his personal record of 42 goals in all competitions in a single season. Although he failed to find the net during Madrid's eventual elimination in the Champions League semi-finals, he equalised from the penalty spot in the return league game and scored the match-winning goal in the 103rd minute of the <a href="/wiki/2011_Copa_del_Rey_Final" title="2011 Copa del Rey Final">Copa del Rey final</a>, winning his first trophy in Spain.<sup id="cite_ref-138" class="reference"><a href="#cite_note-138">&#91;135&#93;</a></sup><sup id="cite_ref-139" class="reference"><a href="#cite_note-139">&#91;136&#93;</a></sup> His two goals in the last match of the season, against <a href="/wiki/UD_Almer%C3%ADa" title="UD Almería">Almería</a>, made him the first player in La Liga to score 40 goals.<sup id="cite_ref-140" class="reference"><a href="#cite_note-140">&#91;137&#93;</a></sup> In addition to the <a href="/wiki/Pichichi_Trophy" title="Pichichi Trophy">Pichichi Trophy</a>, Ronaldo consequently won the European Golden Shoe for a second time, becoming the first player to win the award in two different leagues.<sup id="cite_ref-141" class="reference"><a href="#cite_note-141">&#91;138&#93;</a></sup>
</p>
<div class="thumb tleft"><div class="thumbinner" style="width:172px;"><a href="/wiki/File:Cristiano_Ajax.jpg" class="image"><img alt="" src="//upload.wikimedia.org/wikipedia/commons/thumb/0/0d/Cristiano_Ajax.jpg/170px-Cristiano_Ajax.jpg" decoding="async" width="170" height="309" class="thumbimage" srcset="//upload.wikimedia.org/wikipedia/commons/thumb/0/0d/Cristiano_Ajax.jpg/255px-Cristiano_Ajax.jpg 1.5x, //upload.wikimedia.org/wikipedia/commons/thumb/0/0d/Cristiano_Ajax.jpg/340px-Cristiano_Ajax.jpg 2x" data-file-width="796" data-file-height="1445" /></a>  <div class="thumbcaption"><div class="magnify"><a href="/wiki/File:Cristiano_Ajax.jpg" class="internal" title="Enlarge"></a></div>Ronaldo scored 46 league goals during the La Liga championship success in his third season in Spain.</div></div></div>
<p>During the following campaign, the <a href="/wiki/2011%E2%80%9312_La_Liga" title="2011–12 La Liga">2011–12 season</a>, Ronaldo surpassed his previous goalscoring feats to achieve a new personal best of 60 goals across all competitions.<sup id="cite_ref-142" class="reference"><a href="#cite_note-142">&#91;139&#93;</a></sup>  He regained a place on the <a href="/wiki/2011_FIFA_Ballon_d%27Or" title="2011 FIFA Ballon d&#39;Or">FIFA Ballon d'Or</a> podium, as runner-up to Messi, after scoring hat-tricks against <a href="/wiki/Real_Zaragoza" title="Real Zaragoza">Real Zaragoza</a>, <a href="/wiki/Rayo_Vallecano" title="Rayo Vallecano">Rayo Vallecano</a>, Málaga, <a href="/wiki/CA_Osasuna" title="CA Osasuna">Osasuna</a>, and Sevilla, the last of which put Madrid on top of the league by the season's midway point.<sup id="cite_ref-143" class="reference"><a href="#cite_note-143">&#91;140&#93;</a></sup><sup id="cite_ref-144" class="reference"><a href="#cite_note-144">&#91;141&#93;</a></sup><sup id="cite_ref-145" class="reference"><a href="#cite_note-145">&#91;142&#93;</a></sup>
</p><p>Ronaldo found greater team success in the league, as he helped Real Madrid win their first <a href="/wiki/List_of_Spanish_football_champions" title="List of Spanish football champions">La Liga title</a> in four years, with a record 100 points. Following a hat-trick against Levante, further increasing Madrid's lead over Barcelona,<sup id="cite_ref-146" class="reference"><a href="#cite_note-146">&#91;143&#93;</a></sup> he scored his 100th league goal for Madrid in a 5–1 win over <a href="/wiki/Real_Sociedad" title="Real Sociedad">Real Sociedad</a> on 24 March 2012, a milestone he reached in just 92 matches across three seasons, breaking the previous club record held by <a href="/wiki/Ferenc_Pusk%C3%A1s" title="Ferenc Puskás">Ferenc Puskás</a>.<sup id="cite_ref-147" class="reference"><a href="#cite_note-147">&#91;144&#93;</a></sup> Another hat-trick in the <a href="/wiki/Madrid_derby" class="mw-redirect" title="Madrid derby">Madrid derby</a> against <a href="/wiki/Atl%C3%A9tico_Madrid" title="Atlético Madrid">Atlético Madrid</a> brought his total to 40 league goals, equalling his record of the previous season.<sup id="cite_ref-148" class="reference"><a href="#cite_note-148">&#91;145&#93;</a></sup> His final league goal of the campaign, against Mallorca, took his total to 46 goals, four short of the new record set by Messi,<sup id="cite_ref-149" class="reference"><a href="#cite_note-149">&#91;146&#93;</a></sup> and earned him the distinction of being the first player to score against all 19 opposition teams in a single season in La Liga.<sup id="cite_ref-NESN_150-0" class="reference"><a href="#cite_note-NESN-150">&#91;147&#93;</a></sup>
</p><p>Ronaldo began the <a href="/wiki/2012%E2%80%9313_La_Liga" title="2012–13 La Liga">2012–13 season</a> by lifting the <a href="/wiki/2012_Supercopa_de_Espa%C3%B1a" title="2012 Supercopa de España">Supercopa de España</a>, his third trophy in Spain. With a goal in each leg by the Portuguese, Madrid won the Spanish Super Cup on away goals following a 4–4 aggregate draw against Barcelona.<sup id="cite_ref-Supercopa_12_151-0" class="reference"><a href="#cite_note-Supercopa_12-151">&#91;148&#93;</a></sup> Although Ronaldo publicly commented that he was unhappy with a "professional issue" within the club, prompted by his refusal to celebrate his 150th goal for Madrid,<sup id="cite_ref-152" class="reference"><a href="#cite_note-152">&#91;149&#93;</a></sup> his goalscoring rate did not suffer. After netting a hat-trick, including two penalties, against Deportivo La Coruña, he scored his first <a href="/wiki/List_of_UEFA_Champions_League_hat-tricks" title="List of UEFA Champions League hat-tricks">hat-trick in the Champions League</a> in a 4–1 victory over <a href="/wiki/AFC_Ajax" title="AFC Ajax">Ajax</a>.<sup id="cite_ref-153" class="reference"><a href="#cite_note-153">&#91;150&#93;</a></sup> Four days later, he became the first player to score in six successive <i>Clásicos</i> when he hit a brace in a 2–2 draw at Camp Nou.<sup id="cite_ref-154" class="reference"><a href="#cite_note-154">&#91;151&#93;</a></sup> His performances in 2012 again saw Ronaldo voted second in the running for the <a href="/wiki/2012_FIFA_Ballon_d%27Or" title="2012 FIFA Ballon d&#39;Or">FIFA Ballon d'Or</a>, finishing runner-up to four-time winner Messi.<sup id="cite_ref-155" class="reference"><a href="#cite_note-155">&#91;152&#93;</a></sup>
</p>
<h4><span id="2013.E2.80.932015:_Consecutive_FIFA_Ballon_d.27Or_wins_and_La_D.C3.A9cima"></span><span class="mw-headline" id="2013–2015:_Consecutive_FIFA_Ballon_d'Or_wins_and_La_Décima">2013–2015: Consecutive FIFA Ballon d'Or wins and <i>La Décima</i></span></h4>
<p>Following the 2012–13 winter break, Ronaldo captained Real Madrid for the first time in an official match, scoring a brace to lift 10-man Madrid to a 4–3 victory over Real Sociedad on 6 January.<sup id="cite_ref-156" class="reference"><a href="#cite_note-156">&#91;153&#93;</a></sup> He subsequently became the first non-Spanish player in 60 years to captain Madrid in <i>El Clásico</i> on 30 January, a match which also marked his 500th club appearance.<sup id="cite_ref-157" class="reference"><a href="#cite_note-157">&#91;154&#93;</a></sup> Three days prior, he had scored his 300th club goal as part of a perfect hat-trick against Getafe.<sup id="cite_ref-158" class="reference"><a href="#cite_note-158">&#91;155&#93;</a></sup> He scored his 200th goal for Real Madrid on 8 May in a 6–2 win against Málaga, reaching the landmark in 197 games.<sup id="cite_ref-159" class="reference"><a href="#cite_note-159">&#91;156&#93;</a></sup> He helped Madrid reach the <a href="/wiki/2013_Copa_del_Rey_Final" title="2013 Copa del Rey Final">Copa del Rey final</a> by scoring twice in <i>El Clásico</i>, which marked the sixth successive match at Camp Nou in which he had scored,<sup id="cite_ref-160" class="reference"><a href="#cite_note-160">&#91;157&#93;</a></sup> a Real Madrid record.<sup id="cite_ref-Supercopa_12_151-1" class="reference"><a href="#cite_note-Supercopa_12-151">&#91;148&#93;</a></sup> In the final, he headed the opening goal of an eventual 2–1 defeat to Atlético Madrid, but was shown a red card for violent conduct.<sup id="cite_ref-161" class="reference"><a href="#cite_note-161">&#91;158&#93;</a></sup> In the first knockout round of the Champions League, Ronaldo faced his former club Manchester United for the first time. After scoring the equaliser in a 1–1 draw at the Santiago Bernabéu,<sup id="cite_ref-162" class="reference"><a href="#cite_note-162">&#91;159&#93;</a></sup> he scored the match-winning goal in a 2–1 victory at Old Trafford, his first return to his former home ground.<sup id="cite_ref-163" class="reference"><a href="#cite_note-163">&#91;160&#93;</a></sup> He <a href="/wiki/Goal_celebration#Notable_non-celebrations" title="Goal celebration">did not celebrate scoring</a> against his former club as a mark of respect.<sup id="cite_ref-164" class="reference"><a href="#cite_note-164">&#91;161&#93;</a></sup> After scoring three goals against Galatasaray in the quarters, he scored Madrid's only goal in the 4–1 away defeat to <a href="/wiki/Borussia_Dortmund" title="Borussia Dortmund">Borussia Dortmund</a> in the semi-finals, but failed to increase his side's 2–0 victory in the second leg, as they were eliminated at the semi-final stage for the third consecutive year.<sup id="cite_ref-165" class="reference"><a href="#cite_note-165">&#91;162&#93;</a></sup>
</p>
<div class="thumb tleft"><div class="thumbinner" style="width:172px;"><a href="/wiki/File:CR_derbi_2013_cropped.png" class="image"><img alt="" src="//upload.wikimedia.org/wikipedia/commons/thumb/4/49/CR_derbi_2013_cropped.png/170px-CR_derbi_2013_cropped.png" decoding="async" width="170" height="253" class="thumbimage" srcset="//upload.wikimedia.org/wikipedia/commons/thumb/4/49/CR_derbi_2013_cropped.png/256px-CR_derbi_2013_cropped.png 1.5x, //upload.wikimedia.org/wikipedia/commons/thumb/4/49/CR_derbi_2013_cropped.png/340px-CR_derbi_2013_cropped.png 2x" data-file-width="1721" data-file-height="2557" /></a>  <div class="thumbcaption"><div class="magnify"><a href="/wiki/File:CR_derbi_2013_cropped.png" class="internal" title="Enlarge"></a></div>Ronaldo scored a record 17 <a href="/wiki/UEFA_Champions_League" title="UEFA Champions League">UEFA Champions League</a> goals during the <a href="/wiki/2013%E2%80%9314_Real_Madrid_CF_season" title="2013–14 Real Madrid CF season">2013–14 <i>La Décima</i></a> season.</div></div></div>
<p>At the start of the <a href="/wiki/2013%E2%80%9314_La_Liga" title="2013–14 La Liga">2013–14 season</a>, Ronaldo signed a new contract that extended his stay by three years to 2018, with a salary of €17&#160;million net, making him briefly the highest-paid player in football.<sup id="cite_ref-166" class="reference"><a href="#cite_note-166">&#91;163&#93;</a></sup> He was joined at the club by winger <a href="/wiki/Gareth_Bale" title="Gareth Bale">Gareth Bale</a>, whose world record transfer fee of €100&#160;million surpassed the fee Madrid had paid for Ronaldo four years prior.<sup id="cite_ref-167" class="reference"><a href="#cite_note-167">&#91;164&#93;</a></sup> Together with striker <a href="/wiki/Karim_Benzema" title="Karim Benzema">Karim Benzema</a>, they formed an attacking trio popularly dubbed "BBC", an acronym of Bale, Benzema, and Cristiano, and a play off the <a href="/wiki/BBC" title="BBC">name</a> of the <a href="/wiki/Public_service_broadcaster" class="mw-redirect" title="Public service broadcaster">public service broadcaster</a>.<sup id="cite_ref-168" class="reference"><a href="#cite_note-168">&#91;165&#93;</a></sup> By late November, Ronaldo had scored 32 goals from 22 matches for both club and country, including hat-tricks against Galatasaray, Sevilla, Real Sociedad, <a href="/wiki/Northern_Ireland_national_football_team" title="Northern Ireland national football team">Northern Ireland</a>, and <a href="/wiki/Sweden_national_football_team" title="Sweden national football team">Sweden</a>.<sup id="cite_ref-169" class="reference"><a href="#cite_note-169">&#91;166&#93;</a></sup><sup id="cite_ref-170" class="reference"><a href="#cite_note-170">&#91;167&#93;</a></sup><sup id="cite_ref-171" class="reference"><a href="#cite_note-171">&#91;168&#93;</a></sup> He ended 2013 with 69 goals in 59 appearances, his highest year-end goal tally.<sup id="cite_ref-172" class="reference"><a href="#cite_note-172">&#91;169&#93;</a></sup> He received the <a href="/wiki/2013_FIFA_Ballon_d%27Or" title="2013 FIFA Ballon d&#39;Or">FIFA Ballon d'Or</a>, an amalgamation of the Ballon d'Or and the FIFA World Player of the Year award, for the first time in his career.<sup id="cite_ref-173" class="reference"><a href="#cite_note-173">&#91;170&#93;</a></sup>
</p><p>Concurrently with his individual achievements, Ronaldo enjoyed his greatest team success in Spain to date, as he helped Real Madrid win <i>La Décima</i>, their tenth European Cup. His goal in a 3–0 home win over Borussia Dortmund (his 100th Champions League match) took his total for the season to 14 goals, equalling the record Messi had set two years before.<sup id="cite_ref-174" class="reference"><a href="#cite_note-174">&#91;171&#93;</a></sup> After hitting a brace in a 4–0 defeat of Bayern Munich at the <a href="/wiki/Allianz_Arena" title="Allianz Arena">Allianz Arena</a>,<sup id="cite_ref-175" class="reference"><a href="#cite_note-175">&#91;172&#93;</a></sup> he scored from the penalty spot in the 120th minute of the 4–1 final victory over Atlético Madrid, becoming the first player to score in two European Cup finals for two different winning teams.<sup id="cite_ref-176" class="reference"><a href="#cite_note-176">&#91;173&#93;</a></sup> His overall performance in the final was subdued as a result of <a href="/wiki/Patellar_tendinitis" title="Patellar tendinitis">patellar tendinitis</a> and related hamstring problems, which had plagued him in the last months of the campaign. Ronaldo played the final against medical advice, later commenting: "In your life you do not win without sacrifices and you must take risks."<sup id="cite_ref-career_risk_177-0" class="reference"><a href="#cite_note-career_risk-177">&#91;174&#93;</a></sup> As the Champions League top goalscorer for the third time, with a record 17 goals,<sup id="cite_ref-scoringhonors_178-0" class="reference"><a href="#cite_note-scoringhonors-178">&#91;175&#93;</a></sup> he was named the <a href="/wiki/UEFA_Best_Player_in_Europe" class="mw-redirect" title="UEFA Best Player in Europe">UEFA Best Player in Europe</a>.<sup id="cite_ref-UEFA.com_179-0" class="reference"><a href="#cite_note-UEFA.com-179">&#91;176&#93;</a></sup>
</p><p>In the Copa del Rey, Ronaldo helped Madrid reach the <a href="/wiki/2014_Copa_del_Rey_Final" title="2014 Copa del Rey Final">final</a> by scoring two penalties against Atlético Madrid at the <a href="/wiki/Vicente_Calder%C3%B3n_Stadium" title="Vicente Calderón Stadium">Vicente Calderón</a>,<sup id="cite_ref-180" class="reference"><a href="#cite_note-180">&#91;177&#93;</a></sup> the first of which meant he had now scored in every single minute of a 90-minute football match.<sup id="cite_ref-Treadway_181-0" class="reference"><a href="#cite_note-Treadway-181">&#91;178&#93;</a></sup> His continued issues with his knee and thigh caused him to miss the final, where Real Madrid defeated Barcelona 2–1 to claim the trophy.<sup id="cite_ref-182" class="reference"><a href="#cite_note-182">&#91;179&#93;</a></sup> Ronaldo scored 31 goals in 30 league games, which earned him the Pichichi and the European Golden Shoe, receiving the latter award jointly with Liverpool striker <a href="/wiki/Luis_Su%C3%A1rez" title="Luis Suárez">Luis Suárez</a>.<sup id="cite_ref-183" class="reference"><a href="#cite_note-183">&#91;180&#93;</a></sup> Among his haul was his 400th career goal, in 653 appearances for club and country, which came with a brace against Celta Vigo on 6 January; he dedicated his goals to compatriot <a href="/wiki/Eus%C3%A9bio" title="Eusébio">Eusébio</a>, who had died two days before.<sup id="cite_ref-400Goals_184-0" class="reference"><a href="#cite_note-400Goals-184">&#91;181&#93;</a></sup> A last-minute, back-heeled volley scored against <a href="/wiki/Valencia_CF" title="Valencia CF">Valencia</a> on 4 May (his 50th goal in all competitions) was recognised as the best goal of the season by the <a href="/wiki/Liga_de_F%C3%BAtbol_Profesional" class="mw-redirect" title="Liga de Fútbol Profesional">Liga de Fútbol Profesional</a>,<sup id="cite_ref-185" class="reference"><a href="#cite_note-185">&#91;182&#93;</a></sup> which additionally named Ronaldo the <a href="/wiki/LFP_Awards" class="mw-redirect" title="LFP Awards">Best Player in La Liga</a>.<sup id="cite_ref-Independent_2013–14_186-0" class="reference"><a href="#cite_note-Independent_2013–14-186">&#91;183&#93;</a></sup>
</p><p>During the next campaign, the <a href="/wiki/2014%E2%80%9315_La_Liga" title="2014–15 La Liga">2014–15 season</a>, Ronaldo set a new personal best of 61 goals in all competitions, starting with both goals in Real Madrid's 2–0 victory over Sevilla in the <a href="/wiki/2014_UEFA_Super_Cup" title="2014 UEFA Super Cup">UEFA Super Cup</a>.<sup id="cite_ref-AS_187-0" class="reference"><a href="#cite_note-AS-187">&#91;184&#93;</a></sup> He subsequently achieved his best-ever goalscoring start to a league campaign, with a record 15 goals in the first eight rounds of La Liga.<sup id="cite_ref-Real_Madrid_5–0_Athletic_Bilbao_188-0" class="reference"><a href="#cite_note-Real_Madrid_5–0_Athletic_Bilbao-188">&#91;185&#93;</a></sup> His record 23rd hat-trick in La Liga, scored against Celta Vigo on 6 December, made him the fastest player to reach 200 goals in the Spanish league, as he reached the milestone in only his 178th game.<sup id="cite_ref-Real_Madrid_5–0_Athletic_Bilbao_188-1" class="reference"><a href="#cite_note-Real_Madrid_5–0_Athletic_Bilbao-188">&#91;185&#93;</a></sup><sup id="cite_ref-La_Liga_record_189-0" class="reference"><a href="#cite_note-La_Liga_record-189">&#91;186&#93;</a></sup> After lifting the <a href="/wiki/2014_FIFA_Club_World_Cup" title="2014 FIFA Club World Cup">FIFA Club World Cup</a>
