<p>A versatile <a href="/wiki/Forward_(association_football)" title="Forward (association football)">attacker</a>, Ronaldo is capable of playing on either wing as well as through the centre of the pitch,<sup id="cite_ref-384" class="reference"><a href="#cite_note-384">&#91;380&#93;</a></sup> and, while ostensibly right-footed, is very strong with both feet.<sup id="cite_ref-385" class="reference"><a href="#cite_note-385">&#91;381&#93;</a></sup> He ranks among the world's fastest footballers, both with and without the ball.<sup id="cite_ref-Bolt_del_calcio_386-0" class="reference"><a href="#cite_note-Bolt_del_calcio-386">&#91;382&#93;</a></sup> Tactically, Ronaldo has undergone several evolutions throughout his career. While at Sporting and during his first season at Manchester United, he was typically deployed as a traditional <a href="/wiki/Midfielder#Winger" title="Midfielder">winger</a> on the right side of midfield, where he regularly looked to deliver <a href="/wiki/Cross_(football)" class="mw-redirect" title="Cross (football)">crosses</a> into the penalty area. In this position, he was able to use his pace and acceleration, agility, and technical skills to take on opponents in one-on-one situations. Ronaldo became noted for his <a href="/wiki/Dribbling#Association_football" title="Dribbling">dribbling</a> and flair, often displaying an array of <a href="/wiki/Association_football_tactics_and_skills" title="Association football tactics and skills">tricks</a> and <a href="/wiki/Dummy_(football)" title="Dummy (football)">feints</a>,<sup id="cite_ref-Bolt_del_calcio_386-1" class="reference"><a href="#cite_note-Bolt_del_calcio-386">&#91;382&#93;</a></sup><sup id="cite_ref-Cristiano_Ronaldo_–_Portogallo_387-0" class="reference"><a href="#cite_note-Cristiano_Ronaldo_–_Portogallo-387">&#91;383&#93;</a></sup> such as the <a href="/wiki/Step_over" title="Step over">step overs</a> and so-called 'chops' that became his trademark;<sup id="cite_ref-Grantland_388-0" class="reference"><a href="#cite_note-Grantland-388">&#91;384&#93;</a></sup> he has also been known to use the <a href="/wiki/Flip_flap_(association_football)" title="Flip flap (association football)">flip–flap</a>.<sup id="cite_ref-389" class="reference"><a href="#cite_note-389">&#91;385&#93;</a></sup>
</p>
<div class="thumb tleft"><div class="thumbinner" style="width:252px;"><a href="/wiki/File:Contr%C3%B4le_de_Cristiano_Ronaldo.jpg" class="image"><img alt="" src="//upload.wikimedia.org/wikipedia/commons/thumb/9/9e/Contr%C3%B4le_de_Cristiano_Ronaldo.jpg/250px-Contr%C3%B4le_de_Cristiano_Ronaldo.jpg" decoding="async" width="250" height="163" class="thumbimage" srcset="//upload.wikimedia.org/wikipedia/commons/thumb/9/9e/Contr%C3%B4le_de_Cristiano_Ronaldo.jpg/375px-Contr%C3%B4le_de_Cristiano_Ronaldo.jpg 1.5x, //upload.wikimedia.org/wikipedia/commons/thumb/9/9e/Contr%C3%B4le_de_Cristiano_Ronaldo.jpg/500px-Contr%C3%B4le_de_Cristiano_Ronaldo.jpg 2x" data-file-width="1024" data-file-height="668" /></a>  <div class="thumbcaption"><div class="magnify"><a href="/wiki/File:Contr%C3%B4le_de_Cristiano_Ronaldo.jpg" class="internal" title="Enlarge"></a></div>Ronaldo controlling the ball on his chest during a <a href="/wiki/2010%E2%80%9311_La_Liga" title="2010–11 La Liga">2010–11 La Liga</a> game against <a href="/wiki/UD_Almer%C3%ADa" title="UD Almería">Almería</a>. At his peak, he was known for his exceptional speed and athleticism.<sup id="cite_ref-390" class="reference"><a href="#cite_note-390">&#91;386&#93;</a></sup></div></div></div>
<p>As Ronaldo matured, he underwent a major physical transformation, developing a muscular body type that allowed him to retain possession of the ball under pressure, and strong legs that enabled an outstanding jumping ability.<sup id="cite_ref-391" class="reference"><a href="#cite_note-391">&#91;387&#93;</a></sup> His strength and jumping ability, combined with his elevation, heading accuracy, and height of 1.87&#160;m (6&#160;ft <span class="frac nowrap">1<span class="visualhide">&#160;</span><sup>1</sup>&#8260;<sub>2</sub></span>&#160;in), give him an edge in winning aerial duels. These attributes allow him to function as a target-man and make him an aerial goal threat in the penalty area; consequently, many of his goals have been headers.<sup id="cite_ref-sportsnet-molinaro_392-0" class="reference"><a href="#cite_note-sportsnet-molinaro-392">&#91;388&#93;</a></sup><sup id="cite_ref-393" class="reference"><a href="#cite_note-393">&#91;389&#93;</a></sup><sup id="cite_ref-394" class="reference"><a href="#cite_note-394">&#91;390&#93;</a></sup> Allied with his increased stamina and work-rate, his goalscoring ability improved drastically on the left wing where he was given the positional freedom to move into the centre to finish attacks. He has also increasingly played a <a href="/wiki/Playmaker" title="Playmaker">creative role</a> for his team, often dropping deep to pick up the ball, participate in the build-up of plays, and create chances for his teammates, courtesy of his vision and passing ability.<sup id="cite_ref-Bolt_del_calcio_386-2" class="reference"><a href="#cite_note-Bolt_del_calcio-386">&#91;382&#93;</a></sup><sup id="cite_ref-sportsnet-molinaro_392-1" class="reference"><a href="#cite_note-sportsnet-molinaro-392">&#91;388&#93;</a></sup>
</p><p>In his final seasons at United, Ronaldo played an even more attacking and central role, functioning both as a <a href="/wiki/Forward_(association_football)#Striker" title="Forward (association football)">striker</a> and as a <a href="/wiki/Forward_(association_football)#Second_striker" title="Forward (association football)">supporting forward</a>, or even as an <a href="/wiki/Midfielder#Attacking_midfielder" title="Midfielder">attacking midfielder</a> on occasion.<sup id="cite_ref-Style_of_play_395-0" class="reference"><a href="#cite_note-Style_of_play-395">&#91;391&#93;</a></sup> He developed into a prolific goalscorer, capable of finishing well both inside the penalty area and from distance with an accurate and powerful shot, courtesy of his striking ability.<sup id="cite_ref-sportsnet-molinaro_392-2" class="reference"><a href="#cite_note-sportsnet-molinaro-392">&#91;388&#93;</a></sup><sup id="cite_ref-Style_of_play_395-1" class="reference"><a href="#cite_note-Style_of_play-395">&#91;391&#93;</a></sup><sup id="cite_ref-396" class="reference"><a href="#cite_note-396">&#91;392&#93;</a></sup> An accurate <a href="/wiki/Penalty_kick_(association_football)" title="Penalty kick (association football)">penalty kick</a> taker,<sup id="cite_ref-397" class="reference"><a href="#cite_note-397">&#91;393&#93;</a></sup> he also became a set piece specialist, renowned for his powerful, <a href="/wiki/Curl_(football)" class="mw-redirect" title="Curl (football)">bending</a> <a href="/wiki/Direct_free_kick" class="mw-redirect" title="Direct free kick">free kicks</a>.<sup id="cite_ref-398" class="reference"><a href="#cite_note-398">&#91;394&#93;</a></sup> When taking free kicks, Ronaldo is known for using the <i><a href="/wiki/Knuckleball#Association_football" title="Knuckleball">knuckleball</a></i> technique – which was developed by <a href="/wiki/Juninho_Pernambucano" title="Juninho Pernambucano">Juninho Pernambucano</a>.<sup id="cite_ref-399" class="reference"><a href="#cite_note-399">&#91;395&#93;</a></sup> He also adopts a trademark stance before striking the ball, which involves him standing with his legs far apart.<sup id="cite_ref-400" class="reference"><a href="#cite_note-400">&#91;396&#93;</a></sup> Regarding Cristiano Ronaldo's unique style of taking free kicks, former Manchester United assistant manager <a href="/wiki/Mike_Phelan" title="Mike Phelan">Mike Phelan</a> has commented: "People used to put the ball down, walk away, run up and hit it. He brought in a more dynamic showmanship. He places the ball down, the concentration level is high, he takes his certain amount of steps back so that his standing foot is in the perfect place to hit the ball in the sweet spot. He is the ultimate showman. He has that slight arrogance. When he pulls those shorts up and shows his thighs, he is saying 'All eyes on me' and this is going in. He understands the marketing side of it. The way he struts up and places it; the world is watching him."<sup id="cite_ref-401" class="reference"><a href="#cite_note-401">&#91;397&#93;</a></sup>
</p>
<div class="thumb tright"><div class="thumbinner" style="width:252px;"><a href="/wiki/File:Cristiano_Ronaldo_Real_Madrid_Gareth_Bale_Tottenham.jpg" class="image"><img alt="" src="//upload.wikimedia.org/wikipedia/commons/thumb/7/7f/Cristiano_Ronaldo_Real_Madrid_Gareth_Bale_Tottenham.jpg/250px-Cristiano_Ronaldo_Real_Madrid_Gareth_Bale_Tottenham.jpg" decoding="async" width="250" height="169" class="thumbimage" srcset="//upload.wikimedia.org/wikipedia/commons/thumb/7/7f/Cristiano_Ronaldo_Real_Madrid_Gareth_Bale_Tottenham.jpg/375px-Cristiano_Ronaldo_Real_Madrid_Gareth_Bale_Tottenham.jpg 1.5x, //upload.wikimedia.org/wikipedia/commons/thumb/7/7f/Cristiano_Ronaldo_Real_Madrid_Gareth_Bale_Tottenham.jpg/500px-Cristiano_Ronaldo_Real_Madrid_Gareth_Bale_Tottenham.jpg 2x" data-file-width="2824" data-file-height="1904" /></a>  <div class="thumbcaption"><div class="magnify"><a href="/wiki/File:Cristiano_Ronaldo_Real_Madrid_Gareth_Bale_Tottenham.jpg" class="internal" title="Enlarge"></a></div>As Ronaldo entered his thirties he began to <a href="/wiki/Dribbling#Association_football" title="Dribbling">dribble</a> less.<sup id="cite_ref-evolves_402-0" class="reference"><a href="#cite_note-evolves-402">&#91;398&#93;</a></sup></div></div></div>
<p>At Real Madrid, Ronaldo continued to play a more offensive role, while his creative and defensive duties became more limited, although not entirely diminished.<sup id="cite_ref-Style_of_play_395-2" class="reference"><a href="#cite_note-Style_of_play-395">&#91;391&#93;</a></sup> Initially deployed as a <a href="/wiki/Forward_(association_football)#Centre-forward" title="Forward (association football)">centre forward</a> by managers <a href="/wiki/Manuel_Pellegrini" title="Manuel Pellegrini">Manuel Pellegrini</a> and <a href="/wiki/Jos%C3%A9_Mourinho" title="José Mourinho">José Mourinho</a>, he was later moved back onto the left wing, though in a free tactical role; this position allowed him to drift into the centre at will to get onto the end of crosses and score, or draw out defenders with his movement off the ball and leave space for teammates to exploit.<sup id="cite_ref-Ronaldo&#39;s_rise_at_Real_403-0" class="reference"><a href="#cite_note-Ronaldo&#39;s_rise_at_Real-403">&#91;399&#93;</a></sup><sup id="cite_ref-Argument_Ronaldo_centrally_Real_404-0" class="reference"><a href="#cite_note-Argument_Ronaldo_centrally_Real-404">&#91;400&#93;</a></sup><sup id="cite_ref-405" class="reference"><a href="#cite_note-405">&#91;401&#93;</a></sup> Madrid's counter-attacking style of play also allowed him to become a more efficient and consistent player, as evidenced by his record-breaking goalscoring feats. However, while he mainly drew praise in the media for his prolific goalscoring, he also demonstrated his ability as an effective creator in this role.<sup id="cite_ref-The_Most_Underrated_Man_in_Football_406-0" class="reference"><a href="#cite_note-The_Most_Underrated_Man_in_Football-406">&#91;402&#93;</a></sup><sup id="cite_ref-flourish_407-0" class="reference"><a href="#cite_note-flourish-407">&#91;403&#93;</a></sup><sup id="cite_ref-408" class="reference"><a href="#cite_note-408">&#91;404&#93;</a></sup> This unique role has been described by pundits as that of a "false," "attacking," or "goalscoring winger," as Ronaldo effectively almost functioned as a striker at times with his central runs into the penalty area, despite actually playing on the left flank.<sup id="cite_ref-Ronaldo&#39;s_rise_at_Real_403-1" class="reference"><a href="#cite_note-Ronaldo&#39;s_rise_at_Real-403">&#91;399&#93;</a></sup><sup id="cite_ref-409" class="reference"><a href="#cite_note-409">&#91;405&#93;</a></sup> From 2013 onwards, under manager <a href="/wiki/Carlo_Ancelotti" title="Carlo Ancelotti">Carlo Ancelotti</a>, he effectively adapted his style to the physical effects of ageing with increasingly reduced off the ball movement and general involvement, completing fewer dribbles and passes per game, and instead focusing on short-distance creating and goalscoring.<sup id="cite_ref-Argument_Ronaldo_centrally_Real_404-1" class="reference"><a href="#cite_note-Argument_Ronaldo_centrally_Real-404">&#91;400&#93;</a></sup><sup id="cite_ref-Cristiano_Ronaldo&#39;s_evolution_410-0" class="reference"><a href="#cite_note-Cristiano_Ronaldo&#39;s_evolution-410">&#91;406&#93;</a></sup><sup id="cite_ref-411" class="reference"><a href="#cite_note-411">&#91;407&#93;</a></sup> Since 2017, Ronaldo has adapted his style of play yet again to become more of a free-roaming centre forward under manager <a href="/wiki/Zinedine_Zidane" title="Zinedine Zidane">Zinedine Zidane</a>, a role in which he continued to excel and maintain a prolific goalscoring record; in this position, he earned praise in the media for his intelligent movement both on and off the ball, positional sense, link-up play and finishing, as well as his ability to lose or anticipate his markers, find space in the box, and score from few touches or opportunities.<sup id="cite_ref-412" class="reference"><a href="#cite_note-412">&#91;408&#93;</a></sup><sup id="cite_ref-413" class="reference"><a href="#cite_note-413">&#91;409&#93;</a></sup><sup id="cite_ref-414" class="reference"><a href="#cite_note-414">&#91;410&#93;</a></sup>
</p><p>In his first season at Juventus, Ronaldo continued to play in a variety of different attacking roles under manager <a href="/wiki/Massimiliano_Allegri" title="Massimiliano Allegri">Massimiliano Allegri</a>, depending on whom he was partnered with. While he had occupied an increasingly offensive role in his final years at Real Madrid, at times he functioned in a free role at Juventus, either as a lone striker or in his trademark role on the left wing, in a 4–2–3–1 or 4–3–3 formation, in which he often switched positions with Mario Mandžuki. In this role, he was also given licence to drop deep or even out wide onto the right flank in order to receive the ball, and be more involved in the build-up of plays; as such, aside from scoring goals himself, he began to take on opponents and create chances for other players with greater frequency than he had in his final seasons with Real Madrid. Off the ball, he was also capable of creating space for teammates with his movement and attacking runs into the box, or finishing off chances with his head or feet by getting onto the end of his teammates' crosses.<sup id="cite_ref-415" class="reference"><a href="#cite_note-415">&#91;411&#93;</a></sup><sup id="cite_ref-Ronaldo&#39;s_free_role_with_Juventus_is_a_headache_for_Sarri_416-0" class="reference"><a href="#cite_note-Ronaldo&#39;s_free_role_with_Juventus_is_a_headache_for_Sarri-416">&#91;412&#93;</a></sup> On occasion he also played in an attacking partnership alongside Mandžuki in a 4–3–1–2, 4–4–2, or 3–5–2 formation.<sup id="cite_ref-417" class="reference"><a href="#cite_note-417">&#91;413&#93;</a></sup><sup id="cite_ref-418" class="reference"><a href="#cite_note-418">&#91;414&#93;</a></sup><sup id="cite_ref-419" class="reference"><a href="#cite_note-419">&#91;415&#93;</a></sup> He continued to play a similar role in his second season with the club under manager <a href="/wiki/Maurizio_Sarri" title="Maurizio Sarri">Maurizio Sarri</a>.<sup id="cite_ref-Ronaldo&#39;s_free_role_with_Juventus_is_a_headache_for_Sarri_416-1" class="reference"><a href="#cite_note-Ronaldo&#39;s_free_role_with_Juventus_is_a_headache_for_Sarri-416">&#91;412&#93;</a></sup>
</p>
<h3><span class="mw-headline" id="Reception">Reception</span></h3>
<div class="quotebox pullquote floatright" style="width:30%; ;"><link rel="mw-deduplicated-inline-style" href="mw-data:TemplateStyles:r1012376600"/>
<div class="quotebox-quote left-aligned" style="">"In the six years [Manchester United] had him, you just saw his game grow all the time, and he was a fantastic player. Now you see the complete player. His decision-making, his maturity, his experience, plus all the great skills he has got, they all make him the complete player."</div>
<p><cite class="left-aligned" style="">– Former manager Alex Ferguson, January 2013<sup id="cite_ref-420" class="reference"><a href="#cite_note-420">&#91;416&#93;</a></sup></cite>
</p>
</div>
<p>Ronaldo is widely regarded as one of the two best players of his generation, alongside <a href="/wiki/Lionel_Messi" title="Lionel Messi">Lionel Messi</a>.<sup id="cite_ref-421" class="reference"><a href="#cite_note-421">&#91;note 5&#93;</a></sup> Winning his first <a href="/wiki/2008_Ballon_d%27Or" title="2008 Ballon d&#39;Or">Ballon d'Or</a> in 2008 by a record-high vote count at age 23, over the next decade Ronaldo has often featured in debates concerning who is the greatest player in history.<sup id="cite_ref-422" class="reference"><a href="#cite_note-422">&#91;417&#93;</a></sup> Acclaimed for his prolific and consistent goal-scoring,<sup id="cite_ref-423" class="reference"><a href="#cite_note-423">&#91;note 6&#93;</a></sup> he is considered a decisive player who is also a game changer,<sup id="cite_ref-424" class="reference"><a href="#cite_note-424">&#91;418&#93;</a></sup> especially in important and high-pressured situations.<sup id="cite_ref-425" class="reference"><a href="#cite_note-425">&#91;note 7&#93;</a></sup>
</p>
<div class="thumb tleft"><div class="thumbinner" style="width:222px;"><a href="/wiki/File:SK_20170808_214655_(36289315022).jpg" class="image"><img alt="" src="//upload.wikimedia.org/wikipedia/commons/thumb/2/26/SK_20170808_214655_%2836289315022%29.jpg/220px-SK_20170808_214655_%2836289315022%29.jpg" decoding="async" width="220" height="124" class="thumbimage" srcset="//upload.wikimedia.org/wikipedia/commons/thumb/2/26/SK_20170808_214655_%2836289315022%29.jpg/330px-SK_20170808_214655_%2836289315022%29.jpg 1.5x, //upload.wikimedia.org/wikipedia/commons/thumb/2/26/SK_20170808_214655_%2836289315022%29.jpg/440px-SK_20170808_214655_%2836289315022%29.jpg 2x" data-file-width="4032" data-file-height="2268" /></a>  <div class="thumbcaption"><div class="magnify"><a href="/wiki/File:SK_20170808_214655_(36289315022).jpg" class="internal" title="Enlarge"></a></div>Fans of <a href="/wiki/Real_Madrid_C.F." class="mw-redirect" title="Real Madrid C.F.">Real Madrid</a> (left; Ronaldo's then current club) and <a href="/wiki/Manchester_United_F.C." title="Manchester United F.C.">Manchester United</a> (right; Ronaldo's former club) wearing Ronaldo's No. 7 jersey at the <a href="/wiki/2017_UEFA_Super_Cup" title="2017 UEFA Super Cup">2017 UEFA Super Cup</a></div></div></div>
<p>Ronaldo is noted for his work ethic, elite body conditioning, and dedication to improvement on the training pitch, as well being regarded as a natural leader.<sup id="cite_ref-426" class="reference"><a href="#cite_note-426">&#91;419&#93;</a></sup><sup id="cite_ref-427" class="reference"><a href="#cite_note-427">&#91;420&#93;</a></sup> Writing of his "extraordinary commitment to physical preparation", Adam Bate of <a href="/wiki/Sky_Sports" title="Sky Sports">Sky Sports</a> adds, "Dedication is a huge part of staying at the top and Ronaldo's focus is perhaps unparalleled within the game."<sup id="cite_ref-evolves_402-1" class="reference"><a href="#cite_note-evolves-402">&#91;398&#93;</a></sup> His drive and determination to succeed are fuelled by a desire to be talked about alongside <a href="/wiki/Pel%C3%A9" title="Pelé">Pelé</a> and <a href="/wiki/Diego_Maradona" title="Diego Maradona">Diego Maradona</a> once retiring.<sup id="cite_ref-428" class="reference"><a href="#cite_note-428">&#91;421&#93;</a></sup> He has at times, however, been criticised for <a href="/wiki/Diving_(association_football)" title="Diving (association football)">simulating</a> when tackled.<sup id="cite_ref-429" class="reference"><a href="#cite_note-429">&#91;note 8&#93;</a></sup> In addition to this, he was occasionally criticised early in his career by manager Alex Ferguson, teammates, and the media for being a selfish or overly flamboyant player.<sup id="cite_ref-Ronaldo_selfish_430-0" class="reference"><a href="#cite_note-Ronaldo_selfish-430">&#91;422&#93;</a></sup><sup id="cite_ref-431" class="reference"><a href="#cite_note-431">&#91;423&#93;</a></sup>
</p><p>During his career, Ronaldo has also been described as having an "arrogant image" on the pitch,<sup id="cite_ref-FPMH_432-0" class="reference"><a href="#cite_note-FPMH-432">&#91;424&#93;</a></sup> with Ronaldo stating that he had become a "victim" because of how he was portrayed in the media.<sup id="cite_ref-personality_433-0" class="reference"><a href="#cite_note-personality-433">&#91;425&#93;</a></sup> He is often seen moaning, gesticulating and scowling while trying to inspire his team to victory,<sup id="cite_ref-FPMH_432-1" class="reference"><a href="#cite_note-FPMH-432">&#91;424&#93;</a></sup> with Ronaldo insisting that his competitive nature should not be mistaken for arrogance.<sup id="cite_ref-personality_433-1" class="reference"><a href="#cite_note-personality-433">&#91;425&#93;</a></sup> His managers, teammates and various journalists have commented that this reputation has caused an unfair image of him.<sup id="cite_ref-434" class="reference"><a href="#cite_note-434">&#91;426&#93;</a></sup><sup id="cite_ref-435" class="reference"><a href="#cite_note-435">&#91;427&#93;</a></sup><sup id="cite_ref-436" class="reference"><a href="#cite_note-436">&#91;428&#93;</a></sup> In 2014, Ronaldo told <i><a href="/wiki/France_Football" title="France Football">France Football</a></i> that he had made a "mistake" when he said in 2011, "People are jealous of me as I am rich, handsome and a great player", adding that he had matured since then and fans understood him better.<sup id="cite_ref-437" class="reference"><a href="#cite_note-437">&#91;429&#93;</a></sup>
</p>
<h3><span class="mw-headline" id="Goal_celebrations">Goal celebrations</span></h3>
<p>Ronaldo has adopted several <a href="/wiki/Goal_celebration" title="Goal celebration">goalscoring celebrations</a> throughout his career, including one particular celebration which gained widespread coverage in the media, when he squatted and stared directly into a camera on the sidelines of the pitch with his hand on his chin.<sup id="cite_ref-FIFA_18_celebrations_438-0" class="reference"><a href="#cite_note-FIFA_18_celebrations-438">&#91;430&#93;</a></sup><sup id="cite_ref-Ronaldo-Goal_Celebrations_439-0" class="reference"><a href="#cite_note-Ronaldo-Goal_Celebrations-439">&#91;431&#93;</a></sup><sup id="cite_ref-Ronaldo&#39;s_new_goal_celebration_440-0" class="reference"><a href="#cite_note-Ronaldo&#39;s_new_goal_celebration-440">&#91;432&#93;</a></sup> However, after scoring a goal, he usually celebrates with a "storming jump" and "turn", before "landing in spread-eagled fashion"<sup id="cite_ref-Ronaldo-Goal_Celebrations_439-1" class="reference"><a href="#cite_note-Ronaldo-Goal_Celebrations-439">&#91;431&#93;</a></sup> into his "signature power stance",<sup id="cite_ref-Ronaldo&#39;s_new_goal_celebration_440-1" class="reference"><a href="#cite_note-Ronaldo&#39;s_new_goal_celebration-440">&#91;432&#93;</a></sup> while usually simultaneously exclaiming "Sí" (Spanish and Italian for "yes");<sup id="cite_ref-FIFA_18_celebrations_438-1" class="reference"><a href="#cite_note-FIFA_18_celebrations-438">&#91;430&#93;</a></sup><sup id="cite_ref-441" class="reference"><a href="#cite_note-441">&#91;433&#93;</a></sup> as such, this trademark celebration has been dubbed the "Sii!" in the media.<sup id="cite_ref-FIFA_18_celebrations_438-2" class="reference"><a href="#cite_note-FIFA_18_celebrations-438">&#91;430&#93;</a></sup><sup id="cite_ref-Ronaldo-Goal_Celebrations_439-2" class="reference"><a href="#cite_note-Ronaldo-Goal_Celebrations-439">&#91;431&#93;</a></sup><sup id="cite_ref-442" class="reference"><a href="#cite_note-442">&#91;434&#93;</a></sup>
</p>
<h3><span class="mw-headline" id="Comparisons_to_Lionel_Messi">Comparisons to Lionel Messi</span></h3>
<div role="note" class="hatnote navigation-not-searchable">Main article: <a href="/wiki/Messi%E2%80%93Ronaldo_rivalry" title="Messi–Ronaldo rivalry">Messi–Ronaldo rivalry</a></div>
<div class="thumb tright"><div class="thumbinner" style="width:172px;"><a href="/wiki/File:Cristiano_Ronaldo_and_Lionel_Messi_-_Portugal_vs_Argentina,_9th_February_2011.jpg" class="image"><img alt="" src="//upload.wikimedia.org/wikipedia/commons/thumb/d/d6/Cristiano_Ronaldo_and_Lionel_Messi_-_Portugal_vs_Argentina%2C_9th_February_2011.jpg/170px-Cristiano_Ronaldo_and_Lionel_Messi_-_Portugal_vs_Argentina%2C_9th_February_2011.jpg" decoding="async" width="170" height="227" class="thumbimage" srcset="//upload.wikimedia.org/wikipedia/commons/thumb/d/d6/Cristiano_Ronaldo_and_Lionel_Messi_-_Portugal_vs_Argentina%2C_9th_February_2011.jpg/255px-Cristiano_Ronaldo_and_Lionel_Messi_-_Portugal_vs_Argentina%2C_9th_February_2011.jpg 1.5x, //upload.wikimedia.org/wikipedia/commons/thumb/d/d6/Cristiano_Ronaldo_and_Lionel_Messi_-_Portugal_vs_Argentina%2C_9th_February_2011.jpg/340px-Cristiano_Ronaldo_and_Lionel_Messi_-_Portugal_vs_Argentina%2C_9th_February_2011.jpg 2x" data-file-width="2115" data-file-height="2820" /></a>  <div class="thumbcaption"><div class="magnify"><a href="/wiki/File:Cristiano_Ronaldo_and_Lionel_Messi_-_Portugal_vs_Argentina,_9th_February_2011.jpg" class="internal" title="Enlarge"></a></div>Ronaldo with <a href="/wiki/Lionel_Messi" title="Lionel Messi">Lionel Messi</a> before an <a href="/wiki/Exhibition_match" class="mw-redirect" title="Exhibition match">international friendly</a> between <a href="/wiki/Portugal_national_football_team" title="Portugal national football team">Portugal</a> and <a href="/wiki/Argentina_national_football_team" title="Argentina national football team">Argentina</a> in 2011</div></div></div>
<p>Both players have scored in at least two <a href="/wiki/UEFA_Champions_League" title="UEFA Champions League">UEFA Champions League</a> finals and have regularly broken the 50-goal barrier in a single season. Sports journalists and pundits regularly weigh the individual merits of both players in an attempt to argue who they believe is the best player in modern football or in the history of the game.<sup id="cite_ref-443" class="reference"><a href="#cite_note-443">&#91;435&#93;</a></sup> It has been compared to <a href="/wiki/List_of_sports_rivalries" title="List of sports rivalries">sports rivalries</a> such as the <a href="/wiki/Muhammad_Ali" title="Muhammad Ali">Muhammad Ali</a>–<a href="/wiki/Joe_Frazier" title="Joe Frazier">Joe Frazier</a> rivalry in boxing, the <a href="/wiki/Borg%E2%80%93McEnroe_rivalry" title="Borg–McEnroe rivalry">Borg–McEnroe rivalry</a> in tennis, and the <a href="/wiki/Ayrton_Senna" title="Ayrton Senna">Ayrton Senna</a>–<a href="/wiki/Alain_Prost" title="Alain Prost">Alain Prost</a> rivalry from <a href="/wiki/Formula_One" title="Formula One">Formula One</a> motor racing.<sup id="cite_ref-444" class="reference"><a href="#cite_note-444">&#91;436&#93;</a></sup><sup id="cite_ref-445" class="reference"><a href="#cite_note-445">&#91;437&#93;</a></sup>
</p><p>Some commentators choose to analyse the differing physiques and playing styles of the two,<sup id="cite_ref-446" class="reference"><a href="#cite_note-446">&#91;438&#93;</a></sup> while part of the debate revolves around the contrasting personalities of the two players: Ronaldo is sometimes depicted as an arrogant and theatrical showoff, while Messi is portrayed as a shy, humble character.<sup id="cite_ref-447" class="reference"><a href="#cite_note-447">&#91;439&#93;</a></sup><sup id="cite_ref-448" class="reference"><a href="#cite_note-448">&#91;440&#93;</a></sup><sup id="cite_ref-449" class="reference"><a href="#cite_note-449">&#91;441&#93;</a></sup><sup id="cite_ref-450" class="reference"><a href="#cite_note-450">&#91;442&#93;</a></sup>
</p>
<div class="quotebox pullquote floatleft" style="width:24%; ;"><link rel="mw-deduplicated-inline-style" href="mw-data:TemplateStyles:r1012376600"/>
<div class="quotebox-quote left-aligned" style="">"It's part of my life now. People are bound to compare us. He tries to do his best for his club and for his national team, as I do, and there is a degree of rivalry with both of us trying to do the best for the teams we represent."</div>
<p><cite class="left-aligned" style="">– Cristiano Ronaldo commenting on his rivalry with Messi.<sup id="cite_ref-Marca_2014_451-0" class="reference"><a href="#cite_note-Marca_2014-451">&#91;443&#93;</a></sup></cite>
</p>
</div><p>In a 2012 interview, Ronaldo commented on the rivalry, saying "I think we push each other sometimes in the competition, this is why the competition is so high",<sup id="cite_ref-452" class="reference"><a href="#cite_note-452">&#91;444&#93;</a></sup> while Ronaldo's manager during his time at <a href="/wiki/Manchester_United_F.C." title="Manchester United F.C.">Manchester United</a>, <a href="/wiki/Alex_Ferguson" title="Alex Ferguson">Alex Ferguson</a>, opined that "I don't think the rivalry against each other bothers them. I think they have their own personal pride in terms of wanting to be the best".<sup id="cite_ref-453" class="reference"><a href="#cite_note-453">&#91;445&#93;</a></sup> Messi himself denied any rivalry, saying that it was "only the media, the press, who wants us to be at loggerheads but I've never fought with Cristiano".<sup id="cite_ref-454" class="reference"><a href="#cite_note-454">&#91;446&#93;</a></sup> Responding to the claims that he and Messi do not get on well on a personal level, Ronaldo commented, "We don't have a relationship outside the world of football, just as we don't with a lot of other players", before adding that in years to come he hopes they can laugh about it together, stating; "We have to look on this rivalry with a positive spirit, because it's a good thing."<sup id="cite_ref-Marca_2014_451-1" class="reference"><a href="#cite_note-Marca_2014-451">&#91;443&#93;</a></sup> Representing archrivals Barcelona and Real Madrid, the two players faced each other at least twice every season in the world's biggest club game, <i><a href="/wiki/El_Cl%C3%A1sico" title="El Clásico">El Clásico</a></i>, which is among the world's most viewed annual sporting events.<sup id="cite_ref-455" class="reference"><a href="#cite_note-455">&#91;447&#93;</a></sup>
</p><p>In a debate at <a href="/wiki/Oxford_Union" title="Oxford Union">Oxford Union</a> in October 2013, when asked whether FIFA president <a href="/wiki/Sepp_Blatter" title="Sepp Blatter">Sepp Blatter</a> preferred Messi or Ronaldo, Blatter paid tribute to the work ethic of the Argentine before taking a swipe at Ronaldo, claiming "one of them has more expenses for the hairdresser than the other". Real Madrid demanded – and promptly received – a full apology, and the Portuguese issued his own riposte with a mock-salute celebration after scoring a penalty against Sevilla, after Blatter had described him as a "commander" on the pitch.<sup id="cite_ref-456" class="reference"><a href="#cite_note-456">&#91;448&#93;</a></sup> In August 2019, Ronaldo and Messi were interviewed while sat next to each other prior to the announcement of the <a href="/wiki/UEFA_Men%27s_Player_of_the_Year_Award" title="UEFA Men&#39;s Player of the Year Award">UEFA Men's Player of the Year</a>, with Ronaldo stating, "Of course, we have a good relationship. We haven't had dinner together yet, but I hope in the future. I pushed him and he pushed me as well. So it's good to be part of the history of football."<sup id="cite_ref-457" class="reference"><a href="#cite_note-457">&#91;449&#93;</a></sup>
</p>
<h2><span class="mw-headline" id="Outside_football">Outside football</span></h2>
<div role="note" class="hatnote navigation-not-searchable">See also: <a href="/wiki/Museu_CR7" title="Museu CR7">Museu CR7</a> and <a href="/wiki/Cristiano_Ronaldo_International_Airport" title="Cristiano Ronaldo International Airport">Cristiano Ronaldo International Airport</a></div>
<div class="thumb tright"><div class="thumbinner" style="width:222px;"><a href="/wiki/File:CR7.JPG" class="image"><img alt="Cristiano Ronaldo&#39;s museum with people around it" src="//upload.wikimedia.org/wikipedia/commons/thumb/b/b2/CR7.JPG/220px-CR7.JPG" decoding="async" width="220" height="144" class="thumbimage" srcset="//upload.wikimedia.org/wikipedia/commons/thumb/b/b2/CR7.JPG/330px-CR7.JPG 1.5x, //upload.wikimedia.org/wikipedia/commons/thumb/b/b2/CR7.JPG/440px-CR7.JPG 2x" data-file-width="3846" data-file-height="2523" /></a>  <div class="thumbcaption"><div class="magnify"><a href="/wiki/File:CR7.JPG" class="internal" title="Enlarge"></a></div>The Cristiano Ronaldo Museum, CR7, in Funchal, Madeira. It was opened on 15 December 2013.</div></div></div>
<p>As his reputation grew from his time at Manchester United, Ronaldo has signed many sponsorship deals for consumer products, including sportswear, football boots (since November 2012 Ronaldo has worn the <a href="/wiki/Nike_Mercurial_Vapor" title="Nike Mercurial Vapor">Nike Mercurial Vapor</a> personalized CR7 edition),<sup id="cite_ref-458" class="reference"><a href="#cite_note-458">&#91;450&#93;</a></sup> soft drinks, clothing, automotive lubricants, financial services, electronics, and computer video games.<sup id="cite_ref-459" class="reference"><a href="#cite_note-459">&#91;451&#93;</a></sup><sup id="cite_ref-460" class="reference"><a href="#cite_note-460">&#91;452&#93;</a></sup><sup id="cite_ref-461" class="reference"><a href="#cite_note-461">&#91;453&#93;</a></sup><sup id="cite_ref-462" class="reference"><a href="#cite_note-462">&#91;454&#93;</a></sup> Ronaldo was featured as the cover athlete of EA Sports' <a href="/wiki/FIFA_(video_game_series)" title="FIFA (video game series)"><i>FIFA</i> video game</a> <i><a href="/wiki/FIFA_18" title="FIFA 18">FIFA 18</a></i> and was heavily involved in the game's promotion.<sup id="cite_ref-463" class="reference"><a href="#cite_note-463">&#91;455&#93;</a></sup> His 'Siiii' <a href="/wiki/Goal_celebration" title="Goal celebration">goal celebration</a> features in the <i>FIFA</i> series, accompanied with his own voiceover.<sup id="cite_ref-FIFA_18_celebrations_438-3" class="reference"><a href="#cite_note-FIFA_18_celebrations-438">&#91;430&#93;</a></sup> He was also the face of <i><a href="/wiki/Pro_Evolution_Soccer" title="Pro Evolution Soccer">Pro Evolution Soccer</a></i>, appearing on the cover in <a href="/wiki/Pro_Evolution_Soccer_2008" title="Pro Evolution Soccer 2008">2008</a>, <a href="/wiki/Pro_Evolution_Soccer_2012" title="Pro Evolution Soccer 2012">2012</a>, and <a href="/wiki/Pro_Evolution_Soccer_2013" title="Pro Evolution Soccer 2013">2013</a>.<sup id="cite_ref-464" class="reference"><a href="#cite_note-464">&#91;456&#93;</a></sup>
</p><p>With earnings of €720 million (£615 million) from 2010 to 2019, Ronaldo was ranked second in <i><a href="/wiki/Forbes" title="Forbes">Forbes</a></i> list of The Highest-Paid Athletes Of The Decade, with only boxer <a href="/wiki/Floyd_Mayweather,_Jr." class="mw-redirect" title="Floyd Mayweather, Jr.">Floyd Mayweather, Jr.</a> earning more.<sup id="cite_ref-465" class="reference"><a href="#cite_note-465">&#91;457&#93;</a></sup> <i>Forbes</i> has twice ranked Ronaldo first on its list of the world's highest-paid football players; his combined income from salaries, bonuses, and endorsements was $73&#160;million in 2013–14 and $79&#160;million in 2014–15.<sup id="cite_ref-466" class="reference"><a href="#cite_note-466">&#91;458&#93;</a></sup><sup id="cite_ref-467" class="reference"><a href="#cite_note-467">&#91;459&#93;</a></sup> The latter earnings saw him listed behind only Mayweather on the magazine's list of The World's Highest-Paid Athletes.<sup id="cite_ref-468" class="reference"><a href="#cite_note-468">&#91;460&#93;</a></sup> In 2016, he became the first footballer to top the <i>Forbes</i> list of highest-earning athletes, with a total income of $88&#160;million from his salary and endorsements in 2015–16.<sup id="cite_ref-469" class="reference"><a href="#cite_note-469">&#91;461&#93;</a></sup> He topped the list for the second straight year with earnings of $93&#160;million in 2016–17.<sup id="cite_ref-Forbes_2017_470-0" class="reference"><a href="#cite_note-Forbes_2017-470">&#91;462&#93;</a></sup> Ronaldo is one of the world's most marketable athletes: <i><a href="/wiki/SportsPro" title="SportsPro">SportsPro</a></i> rated him the fifth most marketable athlete in 2012<sup id="cite_ref-SportsPro_2012_471-0" class="reference"><a href="#cite_note-SportsPro_2012-471">&#91;463&#93;</a></sup> and eighth most marketable athlete in 2013, with Brazilian footballer <a href="/wiki/Neymar" title="Neymar">Neymar</a> topping both lists.<sup id="cite_ref-SportsPro_2012_471-1" class="reference"><a href="#cite_note-SportsPro_2012-471">&#91;463&#93;</a></sup><sup id="cite_ref-472" class="reference"><a href="#cite_note-472">&#91;464&#93;</a></sup> Sports market research company Repucom named Ronaldo the most marketable and most recognised football player in the world in May 2014.<sup id="cite_ref-473" class="reference"><a href="#cite_note-473">&#91;465&#93;</a></sup> He was additionally named in the 2014 <a href="/wiki/Time_100" title="Time 100">Time 100</a>, <i><a href="/wiki/Time_(magazine)" title="Time (magazine)">Time</a></i><span class="nowrap" style="padding-left:0.1em;">&#39;</span>s annual list of the most influential people in the world.<sup id="cite_ref-:1_474-0" class="reference"><a href="#cite_note-:1-474">&#91;466&#93;</a></sup> <a href="/wiki/ESPN" title="ESPN">ESPN</a> named Ronaldo the world's most famous athlete in 2016, 2017, 2018, and 2019.<sup id="cite_ref-475" class="reference"><a href="#cite_note-475">&#91;467&#93;</a></sup><sup id="cite_ref-476" class="reference"><a href="#cite_note-476">&#91;468&#93;</a></sup><sup id="cite_ref-477" class="reference"><a href="#cite_note-477">&#91;469&#93;</a></sup><sup id="cite_ref-478" class="reference"><a href="#cite_note-478">&#91;470&#93;</a></sup>
</p>
<div class="thumb tleft"><div class="thumbinner" style="width:202px;"><a href="/wiki/File:Funchal_CR7_Statue.JPG" class="image"><img alt="" src="//upload.wikimedia.org/wikipedia/commons/thumb/f/ff/Funchal_CR7_Statue.JPG/200px-Funchal_CR7_Statue.JPG" decoding="async" width="200" height="267" class="thumbimage" srcset="//upload.wikimedia.org/wikipedia/commons/thumb/f/ff/Funchal_CR7_Statue.JPG/301px-Funchal_CR7_Statue.JPG 1.5x, //upload.wikimedia.org/wikipedia/commons/thumb/f/ff/Funchal_CR7_Statue.JPG/400px-Funchal_CR7_Statue.JPG 2x" data-file-width="3264" data-file-height="4352" /></a>  <div class="thumbcaption"><div class="magnify"><a href="/wiki/File:Funchal_CR7_Statue.JPG" class="internal" title="Enlarge"></a></div>Statue of Ronaldo, in Madeira, resembles the pose he strikes before taking free kicks.<sup id="cite_ref-479" class="reference"><a href="#cite_note-479">&#91;471&#93;</a></sup></div></div></div>
<p>Ronaldo has established a strong online presence. The most popular sportsperson on social media, he counted over 500&#160;million total followers across Facebook, Twitter, and Instagram by February 2021, making him the first person to pass half a billion followers.<sup id="cite_ref-480" class="reference"><a href="#cite_note-480">&#91;472&#93;</a></sup> The most followed person on <a href="/wiki/List_of_most-followed_Facebook_pages" title="List of most-followed Facebook pages">Facebook</a> (150 million) and <a href="/wiki/List_of_most-followed_Instagram_accounts" title="List of most-followed Instagram accounts">Instagram</a> (264 million), and the most followed sportsman on <a href="/wiki/List_of_most-followed_Twitter_accounts" title="List of most-followed Twitter accounts">Twitter</a> (91 million), his sponsors earned $936&#160;million in media value across his social media accounts between June 2016 to June 2017.<sup id="cite_ref-Forbes_2017_470-1" class="reference"><a href="#cite_note-Forbes_2017-470">&#91;462&#93;</a></sup> Ronaldo has released two mobile apps: in December 2011, he launched an <a href="/wiki/IPhone" title="IPhone">iPhone</a> game called <i>Heads Up with Cristiano</i>, created by developer <a href="/wiki/RockLive" title="RockLive">RockLive</a>,<sup id="cite_ref-481" class="reference"><a href="#cite_note-481">&#91;473&#93;</a></sup> and in December 2013, he launched <i>Viva Ronaldo</i>, a dedicated social networking website and mobile app.<sup id="cite_ref-482" class="reference"><a href="#cite_note-482">&#91;474&#93;</a></sup> Computer security company <a href="/wiki/McAfee" title="McAfee">McAfee</a> produced a 2012 report ranking footballers by the probability of an internet search for their name leading to an unsafe website, with Ronaldo's name first on the list.<sup id="cite_ref-483" class="reference"><a href="#cite_note-483">&#91;475&#93;</a></sup>
</p><p>Ronaldo's life and person have been the subject of several works. His autobiography, titled <i>Moments</i>, was published in December 2007.<sup id="cite_ref-484" class="reference"><a href="#cite_note-484">&#91;476&#93;</a></sup> His sponsor Castrol produced the television film <i>Ronaldo: Tested to the Limit</i>, in which he is physically and mentally tested in several areas; his physical performance was consequently subject to scrutiny by world media upon the film's release in September 2011.<sup id="cite_ref-485" class="reference"><a href="#cite_note-485">&#91;477&#93;</a></sup> <i><a href="/wiki/Cristiano_Ronaldo:_The_World_at_His_Feet" title="Cristiano Ronaldo: The World at His Feet">Cristiano Ronaldo: The World at His Feet</a></i>, a documentary narrated by the actor <a href="/wiki/Benedict_Cumberbatch" title="Benedict Cumberbatch">Benedict Cumberbatch</a>, was released via <a href="/wiki/Vimeo" title="Vimeo">Vimeo</a> in June 2014.<sup id="cite_ref-486" class="reference"><a href="#cite_note-486">&#91;478&#93;</a></sup> A documentary film about his life and career, titled <i><a href="/wiki/Ronaldo_(film)" title="Ronaldo (film)">Ronaldo</a></i>, was released worldwide on 9 November 2015.<sup id="cite_ref-Guinness_records_487-0" class="reference"><a href="#cite_note-Guinness_records-487">&#91;479&#93;</a></sup> Directed by BAFTA-winner <a href="/wiki/Anthony_Wonke" title="Anthony Wonke">Anthony Wonke</a>, the film is produced and distributed by Universal Pictures, while <a href="/wiki/Asif_Kapadia" title="Asif Kapadia">Asif Kapadia</a> is the executive producer.<sup id="cite_ref-488" class="reference"><a href="#cite_note-488">&#91;480&#93;</a></sup>
</p>
<div class="thumb tright"><div class="thumbinner" style="width:222px;"><a href="/wiki/File:The_Prime_Minister_of_Portuguese_Republic,_Mr._Antonio_Costa_gifts_to_the_Prime_Minister,_Shri_Narendra_Modi,_the_jersey_of_Portugal_football_team_personally_autographed_by_Cristiano_Ronaldo,_at_Hyderabad_House,_in_New_Delhi.jpg" class="image"><img alt="" src="//upload.wikimedia.org/wikipedia/commons/thumb/5/52/The_Prime_Minister_of_Portuguese_Republic%2C_Mr._Antonio_Costa_gifts_to_the_Prime_Minister%2C_Shri_Narendra_Modi%2C_the_jersey_of_Portugal_football_team_personally_autographed_by_Cristiano_Ronaldo%2C_at_Hyderabad_House%2C_in_New_Delhi.jpg/220px-thumbnail.jpg" decoding="async" width="220" height="163" class="thumbimage" srcset="//upload.wikimedia.org/wikipedia/commons/thumb/5/52/The_Prime_Minister_of_Portuguese_Republic%2C_Mr._Antonio_Costa_gifts_to_the_Prime_Minister%2C_Shri_Narendra_Modi%2C_the_jersey_of_Portugal_football_team_personally_autographed_by_Cristiano_Ronaldo%2C_at_Hyderabad_House%2C_in_New_Delhi.jpg/330px-thumbnail.jpg 1.5x, //upload.wikimedia.org/wikipedia/commons/thumb/5/52/The_Prime_Minister_of_Portuguese_Republic%2C_Mr._Antonio_Costa_gifts_to_the_Prime_Minister%2C_Shri_Narendra_Modi%2C_the_jersey_of_Portugal_football_team_personally_autographed_by_Cristiano_Ronaldo%2C_at_Hyderabad_House%2C_in_New_Delhi.jpg/440px-thumbnail.jpg 2x" data-file-width="2200" data-file-height="1629" /></a>  <div class="thumbcaption"><div class="magnify"><a href="/wiki/File:The_Prime_Minister_of_Portuguese_Republic,_Mr._Antonio_Costa_gifts_to_the_Prime_Minister,_Shri_Narendra_Modi,_the_jersey_of_Portugal_football_team_personally_autographed_by_Cristiano_Ronaldo,_at_Hyderabad_House,_in_New_Delhi.jpg" class="internal" title="Enlarge"></a></div>Portugal Prime Minister <a href="/wiki/Ant%C3%B3nio_Costa" title="António Costa">António Costa</a> presents Indian Prime Minister <a href="/wiki/Narendra_Modi" title="Narendra Modi">Narendra Modi</a> a signed Ronaldo jersey in January 2017</div></div></div>
<p>Demand for a replica Ronaldo jersey has been high throughout his career. In 2008, Ronaldo's number 7 Manchester United jersey was the best-selling sports product under the auspices of the Premier League.<sup id="cite_ref-489" class="reference"><a href="#cite_note-489">&#91;481&#93;</a></sup> In 2015, Ronaldo's number 7 Real Madrid jersey was the second best-selling jersey worldwide, after Messi's number 10 Barcelona jersey.<sup id="cite_ref-490" class="reference"><a href="#cite_note-490">&#91;482&#93;</a></sup> In 2018, within 24 hours of his number 7 Juventus jersey being released, over 520,000 had been sold, with $62.4 million generated in one day.<sup id="cite_ref-491" class="reference"><a href="#cite_note-491">&#91;483&#93;</a></sup>
</p><p>Ronaldo opened his first fashion boutique under the name <i>CR7</i> (his initials and shirt number) on the island of Madeira, Portugal, in 2006. Ronaldo expanded his business with a second clothes boutique in Lisbon in 2008.<sup id="cite_ref-492" class="reference"><a href="#cite_note-492">&#91;484&#93;</a></sup> In partnership with Scandinavian manufacturer JBS Textile Group and the New York fashion designer <a href="/wiki/Richard_Chai" title="Richard Chai">Richard Chai</a>, Ronaldo co-designed a range of underwear and sock line, released in November 2013.<sup id="cite_ref-493" class="reference"><a href="#cite_note-493">&#91;485&#93;</a></sup> He later expanded his <i>CR7</i> fashion brand by launching a line of premium shirts<sup id="cite_ref-494" class="reference"><a href="#cite_note-494">&#91;486&#93;</a></sup> and shoes by July 2014.<sup id="cite_ref-495" class="reference"><a href="#cite_note-495">&#91;487&#93;</a></sup> In September 2015, Ronaldo released his own fragrance, "Legacy", in a partnership with Eden Parfums.<sup id="cite_ref-496" class="reference"><a href="#cite_note-496">&#91;488&#93;</a></sup>
</p><p>In 2007, C.D. Nacional renamed its youth campus Cristiano Ronaldo Campus Futebol (Cristiano Ronaldo Football Campus).<sup id="cite_ref-497" class="reference"><a href="#cite_note-497">&#91;489&#93;</a></sup> In December 2013, Ronaldo opened a museum, <a href="/wiki/Museu_CR7" title="Museu CR7">Museu CR7</a>, in his hometown of Funchal, Madeira, to house trophies and memorabilia of his life and playing career;<sup id="cite_ref-498" class="reference"><a href="#cite_note-498">&#91;490&#93;</a></sup> the museum is an official sponsor of the local football team <a href="/wiki/Uni%C3%A3o_da_Madeira" class="mw-redirect" title="União da Madeira">União da Madeira</a>.<sup id="cite_ref-499" class="reference"><a href="#cite_note-499">&#91;491&#93;</a></sup><sup id="cite_ref-500" class="reference"><a href="#cite_note-500">&#91;492&#93;</a></sup> At a ceremony held at the <a href="/wiki/Bel%C3%A9m_Palace" title="Belém Palace">Belém Palace</a> in January 2014, President of Portugal <a href="/wiki/An%C3%ADbal_Cavaco_Silva" title="Aníbal Cavaco Silva">Aníbal Cavaco Silva</a> raised Ronaldo to the rank of Grand Officer of the <a href="/wiki/Order_of_Prince_Henry" title="Order of Prince Henry">Order of Prince Henry</a>, "to distinguish an athlete of world renown who has been a symbol of Portugal globally, contributing to the international projection of the country and setting an example of tenacity for future generations".<sup id="cite_ref-501" class="reference"><a href="#cite_note-501">&#91;493&#93;</a></sup> A bronze statue of Ronaldo, designed by artist Ricardo Madeira Veloso, was unveiled in Funchal on 21 December 2014.<sup id="cite_ref-502" class="reference"><a href="#cite_note-502">&#91;494&#93;</a></sup>
</p>
<div class="thumb tleft"><div class="thumbinner" style="width:252px;"><a href="/wiki/File:Madeira_Funchal_landing_strip_1990.jpg" class="image"><img alt="" src="//upload.wikimedia.org/wikipedia/commons/thumb/3/3a/Madeira_Funchal_landing_strip_1990.jpg/250px-Madeira_Funchal_landing_strip_1990.jpg" decoding="async" width="250" height="159" class="thumbimage" srcset="//upload.wikimedia.org/wikipedia/commons/thumb/3/3a/Madeira_Funchal_landing_strip_1990.jpg/375px-Madeira_Funchal_landing_strip_1990.jpg 1.5x, //upload.wikimedia.org/wikipedia/commons/thumb/3/3a/Madeira_Funchal_landing_strip_1990.jpg/500px-Madeira_Funchal_landing_strip_1990.jpg 2x" data-file-width="1080" data-file-height="688" /></a>  <div class="thumbcaption"><div class="magnify"><a href="/wiki/File:Madeira_Funchal_landing_strip_1990.jpg" class="internal" title="Enlarge"></a></div><a href="/wiki/Cristiano_Ronaldo_International_Airport" title="Cristiano Ronaldo International Airport">Cristiano Ronaldo International Airport</a> in Madeira. The renaming ceremony took place in March 2017.</div></div></div>
<p>In June 2010, during the build-up to the World Cup, Ronaldo became the fourth footballer&#160;– after <a href="/wiki/Steven_Gerrard" title="Steven Gerrard">Steven Gerrard</a>, Pelé and David Beckham&#160;– to be represented as a waxwork at <a href="/wiki/Madame_Tussauds_London" class="mw-redirect" title="Madame Tussauds London">Madame Tussauds London</a>.<sup id="cite_ref-503" class="reference"><a href="#cite_note-503">&#91;495&#93;</a></sup> Another waxwork of him was presented at the Madrid Wax Museum in December 2013.<sup id="cite_ref-504" class="reference"><a href="#cite_note-504">&#91;496&#93;</a></sup> In June 2015, astronomers led by David Sobral from Lisbon and <a href="/wiki/Leiden" title="Leiden">Leiden</a> discovered a galaxy which they named <a href="/wiki/Cosmos_Redshift_7" title="Cosmos Redshift 7">Cosmos Redshift 7</a> (CR7) in tribute to Ronaldo.<sup id="cite_ref-Galaxy_505-0" class="reference"><a href="#cite_note-Galaxy-505">&#91;497&#93;</a></sup><sup id="cite_ref-506" class="reference"><a href="#cite_note-506">&#91;498&#93;</a></sup>
</p><p>On 23 July 2016, following Portugal's triumph at Euro 2016, Madeira Airport in Funchal was renamed as <a href="/wiki/Cristiano_Ronaldo_International_Airport" title="Cristiano Ronaldo International Airport">Cristiano Ronaldo International Airport</a>.<sup id="cite_ref-507" class="reference"><a href="#cite_note-507">&#91;499&#93;</a></sup> The unveiling of the rebranded terminal took place on 29 March 2017, which included a bust of his head being presented.<sup id="cite_ref-airportrename_508-0" class="reference"><a href="#cite_note-airportrename-508">&#91;500&#93;</a></sup> The bust and the name change were controversial, with the lack of the bust's likeness to Ronaldo being ridiculed by comedians, including <i><a href="/wiki/Saturday_Night_Live" title="Saturday Night Live">Saturday Night Live</a></i>,<sup id="cite_ref-509" class="reference"><a href="#cite_note-509">&#91;501&#93;</a></sup> while the name change was subject to much debate locally by some politicians and citizens, who even started a petition against the move, an action criticised by President of Madeira <a href="/wiki/Miguel_Albuquerque" title="Miguel Albuquerque">Miguel Albuquerque</a>.<sup id="cite_ref-510" class="reference"><a href="#cite_note-510">&#91;502&#93;</a></sup><sup id="cite_ref-airportrename_508-1" class="reference"><a href="#cite_note-airportrename-508">&#91;500&#93;</a></sup> A year later, sports website <a href="/wiki/Bleacher_Report" title="Bleacher Report">Bleacher Report</a> commissioned sculptor <a href="/wiki/Emanuel_Santos" title="Emanuel Santos">Emanuel Santos</a> to create another bust.<sup id="cite_ref-511" class="reference"><a href="#cite_note-511">&#91;503&#93;</a></sup> However, this bust was never used; instead, a new one was made by a Spanish sculptor, shown to the public on 15 June 2018.<sup id="cite_ref-512" class="reference"><a href="#cite_note-512">&#91;504&#93;</a></sup>
</p><p>In February 2020, the <a href="/wiki/United_Arab_Emirates" title="United Arab Emirates">United Arab Emirates</a> awarded a golden visa to Ronaldo, under the <a href="/wiki/Dubai_Sports_Council" title="Dubai Sports Council">Dubai Sports Council</a> initiative to connect global players, and to encourage them to live and invest in the UAE.<sup id="cite_ref-513" class="reference"><a href="#cite_note-513">&#91;505&#93;</a></sup>
</p>
<h2><span class="mw-headline" id="Personal_life">Personal life</span></h2>
<h3><span id="Family.2C_children_and_relationships"></span><span class="mw-headline" id="Family,_children_and_relationships">Family, children and relationships</span></h3>
<p>Ronaldo has four children. He first became a father to a son, Cristiano Jr., born on 17 June 2010 in the United States.<sup id="cite_ref-514" class="reference"><a href="#cite_note-514">&#91;506&#93;</a></sup> He stated that he has full custody of the child and would not be publicly revealing the identity of the mother as per agreement with her.<sup id="cite_ref-515" class="reference"><a href="#cite_note-515">&#91;507&#93;</a></sup><sup id="cite_ref-tel_child_516-0" class="reference"><a href="#cite_note-tel_child-516">&#91;508&#93;</a></sup> In January 2015, Ronaldo announced his five-year relationship with Russian model <a href="/wiki/Irina_Shayk" title="Irina Shayk">Irina Shayk</a> had ended.<sup id="cite_ref-517" class="reference"><a href="#cite_note-517">&#91;509&#93;</a></sup>
</p><p>Ronaldo then became father to twins, daughter Eva and son Mateo, born on 8 June 2017 in the United States via <a href="/wiki/Surrogacy" title="Surrogacy">surrogacy</a>.<sup id="cite_ref-518" class="reference"><a href="#cite_note-518">&#91;510&#93;</a></sup> He is in a relationship with Spanish model Georgina Rodríguez, a former shop assistant,<sup id="cite_ref-519" class="reference"><a href="#cite_note-519">&#91;511&#93;</a></sup> who gave birth to their daughter Alana Martina, on 12 November 2017.<sup id="cite_ref-520" class="reference"><a href="#cite_note-520">&#91;512&#93;</a></sup>
</p><p>Ronaldo's father, José, died of an alcoholism-related liver condition at age 52 in September 2005 when Ronaldo was 20.<sup id="cite_ref-521" class="reference"><a href="#cite_note-521">&#91;513&#93;</a></sup><sup id="cite_ref-522" class="reference"><a href="#cite_note-522">&#91;514&#93;</a></sup> Ronaldo has said that he <a href="/wiki/Teetotalism" title="Teetotalism">does not drink alcohol</a>,<sup id="cite_ref-523" class="reference"><a href="#cite_note-523">&#91;515&#93;</a></sup> and he received <a href="/wiki/Defamation" title="Defamation">libel</a> damages over a <i><a href="/wiki/The_Daily_Telegraph" title="The Daily Telegraph">Daily Telegraph</a></i> article that reported him drinking heavily in a nightclub while recovering from an injury in July 2008.<sup id="cite_ref-524" class="reference"><a href="#cite_note-524">&#91;516&#93;</a></sup> He also does not have any tattoos as he regularly <a href="/wiki/Blood_donation" title="Blood donation">donates blood</a> and <a href="/wiki/Bone_marrow" title="Bone marrow">bone marrow</a>.<sup id="cite_ref-525" class="reference"><a href="#cite_note-525">&#91;517&#93;</a></sup> His mother, Dolores, was diagnosed with <a href="/wiki/Breast_cancer" title="Breast cancer">breast cancer</a> in 2007, but eventually recovered.<sup id="cite_ref-526" class="reference"><a href="#cite_note-526">&#91;518&#93;</a></sup>
</p>
<h3><span class="mw-headline" id="Philanthropy">Philanthropy</span></h3>
<div class="thumb tright"><div class="thumbinner" style="width:172px;"><a href="/wiki/File:Cristiano_Ronaldo,_2010.jpg" class="image"><img alt="" src="//upload.wikimedia.org/wikipedia/commons/thumb/6/61/Cristiano_Ronaldo%2C_2010.jpg/170px-Cristiano_Ronaldo%2C_2010.jpg" decoding="async" width="170" height="230" class="thumbimage" srcset="//upload.wikimedia.org/wikipedia/commons/thumb/6/61/Cristiano_Ronaldo%2C_2010.jpg/255px-Cristiano_Ronaldo%2C_2010.jpg 1.5x, //upload.wikimedia.org/wikipedia/commons/thumb/6/61/Cristiano_Ronaldo%2C_2010.jpg/340px-Cristiano_Ronaldo%2C_2010.jpg 2x" data-file-width="781" data-file-height="1056" /></a>  <div class="thumbcaption"><div class="magnify"><a href="/wiki/File:Cristiano_Ronaldo,_2010.jpg" class="internal" title="Enlarge"></a></div>Ronaldo pictured in 2010</div></div></div>
<p>Ronaldo has made contributions to various charitable causes throughout his career. Television footage of the <a href="/wiki/2004_Indian_Ocean_earthquake_and_tsunami" title="2004 Indian Ocean earthquake and tsunami">2004 Indian Ocean earthquake and tsunami</a> showed an eight-year-old boy survivor named <a href="/wiki/Martunis" title="Martunis">Martunis</a> wearing a Portuguese football shirt who was stranded for 19 days after his family was killed. Following this, Ronaldo visited <a href="/wiki/Aceh" title="Aceh">Aceh</a>, Indonesia, to raise funds for rehabilitation and reconstruction.<sup id="cite_ref-527" class="reference"><a href="#cite_note-527">&#91;519&#93;</a></sup><sup id="cite_ref-528" class="reference"><a href="#cite_note-528">&#91;520&#93;</a></sup> After accepting undisclosed damages from a libel case against <i><a href="/wiki/The_Sun_(United_Kingdom)" title="The Sun (United Kingdom)">The Sun</a></i> newspaper in 2008, Ronaldo donated the damages to a charity in <a href="/wiki/Madeira" title="Madeira">Madeira</a>.<sup id="cite_ref-529" class="reference"><a href="#cite_note-529">&#91;521&#93;</a></sup> In 2009, Ronaldo donated £100,000 to the hospital that saved his mother's life in <a href="/wiki/Madeira" title="Madeira">Madeira</a> following her battle with cancer, so that they could build a cancer centre on the island.<sup id="cite_ref-530" class="reference"><a href="#cite_note-530">&#91;522&#93;</a></sup> In support of the victims of the <a href="/wiki/2010_Madeira_floods_and_mudslides" title="2010 Madeira floods and mudslides">2010 Madeira flood</a>, Ronaldo pledged to play in a charity match in Madeira between Primeira Liga club Porto and players from Madeiran-based clubs <a href="/wiki/C.S._Mar%C3%ADtimo" title="C.S. Marítimo">Marítimo</a> and Nacional.<sup id="cite_ref-Reuters22Feb2010CharityMatch_531-0" class="reference"><a href="#cite_note-Reuters22Feb2010CharityMatch-531">&#91;523&#93;</a></sup>
</p><p>In 2012, Ronaldo and his agent paid for specialist treatment for a nine-year-old Canarian boy with apparently terminal cancer.<sup id="cite_ref-532" class="reference"><a href="#cite_note-532">&#91;524&#93;</a></sup> In December 2012, Ronaldo joined FIFA's "11 for Health" programme to raise awareness amongst kids of how to steer clear of conditions including drug addiction, HIV, malaria and obesity.<sup id="cite_ref-533" class="reference"><a href="#cite_note-533">&#91;525&#93;</a></sup> In January 2013, Ronaldo became <a href="/wiki/Save_the_Children" title="Save the Children">Save the Children</a>'s new Global Artist Ambassador, in which he hopes to help fight child hunger and obesity.<sup id="cite_ref-534" class="reference"><a href="#cite_note-534">&#91;526&#93;</a></sup> In March, Ronaldo agreed to be the ambassador for The Mangrove Care Forum in Indonesia, an organisation aiming to raise awareness of <a href="/wiki/Mangrove" title="Mangrove">mangrove</a> conservation.<sup id="cite_ref-535" class="reference"><a href="#cite_note-535">&#91;527&#93;</a></sup>
</p><p>Ronaldo was named the world's most charitable sportsperson in 2015 after donating £5 million to the relief effort after the <a href="/wiki/April_2015_Nepal_earthquake" title="April 2015 Nepal earthquake">earthquake in Nepal</a> which killed over 8,000 people.<sup id="cite_ref-Independent_2016_536-0" class="reference"><a href="#cite_note-Independent_2016-536">&#91;528&#93;</a></sup> In June 2016, Ronaldo donated the entirety of his €600,000 Champions League bonus after Real Madrid won the 2015–16 UEFA Champions League.<sup id="cite_ref-Independent_2016_536-1" class="reference"><a href="#cite_note-Independent_2016-536">&#91;528&#93;</a></sup> In August 2016, Ronaldo launched CR7Selfie, a <a href="/wiki/Selfie" title="Selfie">selfie</a> app for charity to help Save the Children that lets participants take a selfie with him in one of several different outfits and poses.<sup id="cite_ref-537" class="reference"><a href="#cite_note-537">&#91;529&#93;</a></sup> In the app, fans can select from among 68 photos of Ronaldo in different outfits and poses, and scroll through 39 filters to apply to their selfies.<sup id="cite_ref-538" class="reference"><a href="#cite_note-538">&#91;530&#93;</a></sup>
</p>
<h3><span class="mw-headline" id="Legal_issues">Legal issues</span></h3>
<p>In July 2017, Ronaldo was charged with fraudulently evading almost €15&#160;million in tax between 2011 and 2014, a claim he denied at the time.<sup id="cite_ref-539" class="reference"><a href="#cite_note-539">&#91;531&#93;</a></sup> In June 2018, Ronaldo was given a two-year suspended jail sentence and fined €18.8&#160;million, later reduced to €16.8&#160;million after reaching a deal with Spanish authorities. The sentence can be served under probation, without any jail time, so long as he does not re-offend.<sup id="cite_ref-540" class="reference"><a href="#cite_note-540">&#91;532&#93;</a></sup>
</p><p>Ronaldo and another man were investigated by the British <a href="/wiki/Crown_Prosecution_Service" title="Crown Prosecution Service">Crown Prosecution Service</a> after a 2005 rape allegation was brought forward by two women. Within days, the two women withdrew their allegation and <a href="/wiki/Scotland_Yard" title="Scotland Yard">Scotland Yard</a> later issued a statement declaring there was not enough evidence for a prosecution.<sup id="cite_ref-541" class="reference"><a href="#cite_note-541">&#91;533&#93;</a></sup> In April 2017, it was reported that Ronaldo was being investigated for a rape allegation by the <a href="/wiki/Las_Vegas_Metropolitan_Police_Department" title="Las Vegas Metropolitan Police Department">Las Vegas Police Department</a> originating in 2009.<sup id="cite_ref-Spiegel_542-0" class="reference"><a href="#cite_note-Spiegel-542">&#91;534&#93;</a></sup><sup id="cite_ref-543" class="reference"><a href="#cite_note-543">&#91;535&#93;</a></sup> Documents, confirmed by Ronaldo's lawyers, state that Ronaldo paid a woman <a href="/wiki/United_States_dollar" title="United States dollar">US$</a>375,000 in a <a href="/wiki/Non-disclosure_agreement" title="Non-disclosure agreement">non-disclosure settlement</a>.<sup id="cite_ref-Spiegel_542-1" class="reference"><a href="#cite_note-Spiegel-542">&#91;534&#93;</a></sup><sup id="cite_ref-544" class="reference"><a href="#cite_note-544">&#91;536&#93;</a></sup> Ronaldo and his lawyers issued a lengthy statement denying all accusations, describing them as an "intentional defamation campaign" with parts significantly "altered and/or completely fabricated",<sup id="cite_ref-545" class="reference"><a href="#cite_note-545">&#91;537&#93;</a></sup><sup id="cite_ref-546" class="reference"><a href="#cite_note-546">&#91;538&#93;</a></sup> a claim which <i>Der Spiegel</i> categorically denied.<sup id="cite_ref-547" class="reference"><a href="#cite_note-547">&#91;539&#93;</a></sup> In July 2019, Las Vegas prosecutors said they would not charge Ronaldo over allegations of rape; the statement added: "Based upon a review of information at this time, the allegations of sexual assault against Cristiano Ronaldo cannot be proven beyond a <a href="/wiki/Reasonable_doubt" title="Reasonable doubt">reasonable doubt</a>."<sup id="cite_ref-548" class="reference"><a href="#cite_note-548">&#91;540&#93;</a></sup>
</p>
<h2><span class="mw-headline" id="Career_statistics">Career statistics</span></h2>
<h3><span class="mw-headline" id="Club">Club</span></h3>
<dl><dd><i>As of match played 14 March 2021.</i><sup id="cite_ref-549" class="reference"><a href="#cite_note-549">&#91;541&#93;</a></sup><sup id="cite_ref-SW_550-0" class="reference"><a href="#cite_note-SW-550">&#91;542&#93;</a></sup><sup id="cite_ref-551" class="reference"><a href="#cite_note-551">&#91;543&#93;</a></sup></dd></dl>
<table class="wikitable" style="text-align:center">
<caption>Appearances and goals by club, season and competition
</caption>
<tbody><tr>
<th rowspan="2">Club
</th>
<th rowspan="2">Season
</th>

<h2><span class="mw-headline" id="Honours">Honours</span></h2>
<div role="note" class="hatnote navigation-not-searchable">For a comprehensive listing of Ronaldo's achievements, see <a href="/wiki/List_of_career_achievements_by_Cristiano_Ronaldo" title="List of career achievements by Cristiano Ronaldo">List of career achievements by Cristiano Ronaldo</a>.</div>
<div class="thumb tright"><div class="thumbinner" style="width:172px;"><a href="/wiki/File:Cristiano_Ronaldo_-_Ballon_d%27Or_(cropped).jpg" class="image"><img alt="" src="//upload.wikimedia.org/wikipedia/commons/thumb/c/cd/Cristiano_Ronaldo_-_Ballon_d%27Or_%28cropped%29.jpg/170px-Cristiano_Ronaldo_-_Ballon_d%27Or_%28cropped%29.jpg" decoding="async" width="170" height="287" class="thumbimage" srcset="//upload.wikimedia.org/wikipedia/commons/thumb/c/cd/Cristiano_Ronaldo_-_Ballon_d%27Or_%28cropped%29.jpg/255px-Cristiano_Ronaldo_-_Ballon_d%27Or_%28cropped%29.jpg 1.5x, //upload.wikimedia.org/wikipedia/commons/thumb/c/cd/Cristiano_Ronaldo_-_Ballon_d%27Or_%28cropped%29.jpg/340px-Cristiano_Ronaldo_-_Ballon_d%27Or_%28cropped%29.jpg 2x" data-file-width="1530" data-file-height="2580" /></a>  <div class="thumbcaption"><div class="magnify"><a href="/wiki/File:Cristiano_Ronaldo_-_Ballon_d%27Or_(cropped).jpg" class="internal" title="Enlarge"></a></div>Cristiano Ronaldo, with his <a href="/wiki/2014_FIFA_Ballon_d%27Or#FIFA_Ballon_d&#39;Or" title="2014 FIFA Ballon d&#39;Or">third Ballon d'Or</a>, receives adulation from Real Madrid fans at the <a href="/wiki/Santiago_Bernab%C3%A9u_Stadium" title="Santiago Bernabéu Stadium">Santiago Bernabéu</a> in January 2015</div></div></div>
<p><b>Sporting CP</b><sup id="cite_ref-592" class="reference"><a href="#cite_note-592">&#91;549&#93;</a></sup>
</p>
<ul><li><a href="/wiki/Superta%C3%A7a_C%C3%A2ndido_de_Oliveira" title="Supertaça Cândido de Oliveira">Supertaça Cândido de Oliveira</a>: <a href="/wiki/2002_Superta%C3%A7a_C%C3%A2ndido_de_Oliveira" title="2002 Supertaça Cândido de Oliveira">2002</a></li></ul>
<p><b>Manchester United</b><sup id="cite_ref-PremProfile_593-0" class="reference"><a href="#cite_note-PremProfile-593">&#91;550&#93;</a></sup><sup id="cite_ref-honours_594-0" class="reference"><a href="#cite_note-honours-594">&#91;551&#93;</a></sup>

<li><a href="/wiki/UEFA_Champions_League" title="UEFA Champions League">UEFA Champions League</a>: <a href="/wiki/2013%E2%80%9314_UEFA_Champions_League" title="2013–14 UEFA Champions League">2013–14</a>, <a href="/wiki/2015%E2%80%9316_UEFA_Champions_League" title="2015–16 UEFA Champions League">2015–16</a>, <a href="/wiki/2016%E2%80%9317_UEFA_Champions_League" title="2016–17 UEFA Champions League">2016–17</a>, <a href="/wiki/2017%E2%80%9318_UEFA_Champions_League" title="2017–18 UEFA Champions League">2017–18</a></li>

<li><a href="/wiki/FIFA_Club_World_Cup" title="FIFA Club World Cup">FIFA Club World Cup</a>: <a href="/wiki/2014_FIFA_Club_World_Cup" title="2014 FIFA Club World Cup">2014</a>, <a href="/wiki/2016_FIFA_Club_World_Cup" title="2016 FIFA Club World Cup">2016</a>, <a href="/wiki/2017_FIFA_Club_World_Cup" title="2017 FIFA Club World Cup">2017</a></li></ul>

<li>IFFHS World's Best National Goal Scorer: 2020<sup id="cite_ref-649" class="reference"><a href="#cite_note-649">&#91;606&#93;</a></sup></li>
<li>IFFHS World's Best Top Goal Scorer: 2011, 2013, 2014, 2015<sup id="cite_ref-650" class="reference"><a href="#cite_note-650">&#91;607&#93;</a></sup></li>
<li>IFFHS World's Best National Goal Scorer of XXI Century 2001–2020<sup id="cite_ref-651" class="reference"><a href="#cite_note-651">&#91;608&#93;</a></sup></li>
<li>IFFHS World's Best Top Goal Scorer of XXI Century 2001–2020<sup id="cite_ref-652" class="reference"><a href="#cite_note-652">&#91;609&#93;</a></sup></li>
<li>IFFHS World's Best Top Goal Scorer of the Decade 2011–2020<sup id="cite_ref-653" class="reference"><a href="#cite_note-653">&#91;610&#93;</a></sup></li>
<li>IFFHS World's Best International Goal Scorer of XXI Century 2001–2020<sup id="cite_ref-654" class="reference"><a href="#cite_note-654">&#91;611&#93;</a></sup></li></ul>
<p><b>Orders</b>
</p>
<ul><li><a href="/wiki/File:PRT_Ordem_de_Nossa_Senhora_da_Conceicao_de_Vila_Vicosa_Cavaleiro_ribbon.svg" class="image"><img alt="PRT Ordem de Nossa Senhora da Conceicao de Vila Vicosa Cavaleiro ribbon.svg" src="//upload.wikimedia.org/wikipedia/commons/thumb/0/0f/PRT_Ordem_de_Nossa_Senhora_da_Conceicao_de_Vila_Vicosa_Cavaleiro_ribbon.svg/60px-PRT_Ordem_de_Nossa_Senhora_da_Conceicao_de_Vila_Vicosa_Cavaleiro_ribbon.svg.png" decoding="async" width="60" height="17" srcset="//upload.wikimedia.org/wikipedia/commons/thumb/0/0f/PRT_Ordem_de_Nossa_Senhora_da_Conceicao_de_Vila_Vicosa_Cavaleiro_ribbon.svg/90px-PRT_Ordem_de_Nossa_Senhora_da_Conceicao_de_Vila_Vicosa_Cavaleiro_ribbon.svg.png 1.5x, //upload.wikimedia.org/wikipedia/commons/thumb/0/0f/PRT_Ordem_de_Nossa_Senhora_da_Conceicao_de_Vila_Vicosa_Cavaleiro_ribbon.svg/120px-PRT_Ordem_de_Nossa_Senhora_da_Conceicao_de_Vila_Vicosa_Cavaleiro_ribbon.svg.png 2x" data-file-width="218" data-file-height="60" /></a> Medal of Merit, <a href="/wiki/Order_of_the_Immaculate_Conception_of_Vila_Vi%C3%A7osa" title="Order of the Immaculate Conception of Vila Viçosa">Order of the Immaculate Conception of Vila Viçosa</a> (<a href="/wiki/House_of_Braganza" title="House of Braganza">Portuguese Royal Family</a>)<sup id="cite_ref-655" class="reference"><a href="#cite_note-655">&#91;612&#93;</a></sup></li>
<li><a href="/wiki/File:PRT_Order_of_Prince_Henry_-_Grand_Officer_BAR.png" class="image"><img alt="PRT Order of Prince Henry - Grand Officer BAR.png" src="//upload.wikimedia.org/wikipedia/commons/thumb/6/62/PRT_Order_of_Prince_Henry_-_Grand_Officer_BAR.png/60px-PRT_Order_of_Prince_Henry_-_Grand_Officer_BAR.png" decoding="async" width="60" height="17" srcset="//upload.wikimedia.org/wikipedia/commons/thumb/6/62/PRT_Order_of_Prince_Henry_-_Grand_Officer_BAR.png/90px-PRT_Order_of_Prince_Henry_-_Grand_Officer_BAR.png 1.5x, //upload.wikimedia.org/wikipedia/commons/thumb/6/62/PRT_Order_of_Prince_Henry_-_Grand_Officer_BAR.png/120px-PRT_Order_of_Prince_Henry_-_Grand_Officer_BAR.png 2x" data-file-width="218" data-file-height="60" /></a> Grand officer of the <a href="/wiki/Order_of_Prince_Henry" title="Order of Prince Henry">Order of Prince Henry</a><sup id="cite_ref-656" class="reference"><a href="#cite_note-656">&#91;613&#93;</a></sup></li>

<h2><span class="mw-headline" id="References">References</span></h2>
<p><b>Notes</b>
</p>
<link rel="mw-deduplicated-inline-style" href="mw-data:TemplateStyles:r1011085734"/><div class="reflist reflist-columns references-column-width" style="column-width: 30em;">
<ol class="references">
<li id="cite_note-9"><span class="mw-cite-backlink"><b><a href="#cite_ref-9">^</a></b></span> <span class="reference-text">The number varies between 1.85 and 1.89 by source. <i><a href="/wiki/Sports_Illustrated" title="Sports Illustrated">Sports Illustrated</a></i> gives 1.85,<sup id="cite_ref-2" class="reference"><a href="#cite_note-2">&#91;2&#93;</a></sup> <a href="/w/index.php?title=Luca_Caioli&amp;action=edit&amp;redlink=1" class="new" title="Luca Caioli (page does not exist)">Luca Caioli</a><span class="noprint" style="font-size:85%; font-style: normal;">&#160;&#91;<a href="https://es.wikipedia.org/wiki/Luca_Caioli" class="extiw" title="es:Luca Caioli">es</a>; <a href="https://fi.wikipedia.org/wiki/Luca_Caioli" class="extiw" title="fi:Luca Caioli">fi</a>&#93;</span> 1.86,<sup id="cite_ref-FOOTNOTECaioli2016_3-0" class="reference"><a href="#cite_note-FOOTNOTECaioli2016-3">&#91;3&#93;</a></sup> <a href="/wiki/FIFA" title="FIFA">FIFA</a>, <a href="/wiki/EA_Sports" title="EA Sports">EA Sports</a>, Soccerway, and <a href="/wiki/Eurosport" title="Eurosport">Eurosport</a> 1.87,<sup id="cite_ref-4" class="reference"><a href="#cite_note-4">&#91;4&#93;</a></sup><sup id="cite_ref-5" class="reference"><a href="#cite_note-5">&#91;5&#93;</a></sup><sup id="cite_ref-6" class="reference"><a href="#cite_note-6">&#91;6&#93;</a></sup><sup id="cite_ref-7" class="reference"><a href="#cite_note-7">&#91;7&#93;</a></sup> and  the <a href="/wiki/Portuguese_Football_Federation" title="Portuguese Football Federation">Portuguese Football Federation</a> 1.89.<sup id="cite_ref-FPF_8-0" class="reference"><a href="#cite_note-FPF-8">&#91;8&#93;</a></sup></span>
</li>
<li id="cite_note-11"><span class="mw-cite-backlink"><b><a href="#cite_ref-11">^</a></b></span> <span class="reference-text">Though there was no third place playoff, UEFA decided in the 2012 edition to award the semi-final losers (Germany and Portugal) bronze medals for the first time.<sup id="cite_ref-10" class="reference"><a href="#cite_note-10">&#91;9&#93;</a></sup></span>
</li>
<li id="cite_note-12"><span class="mw-cite-backlink"><b><a href="#cite_ref-12">^</a></b></span> <span class="reference-text">The terminology for the award has varied. Ronaldo received three Ballon d'Or (<a href="/wiki/2008_Ballon_d%27Or" title="2008 Ballon d&#39;Or">2008</a>, <a href="/wiki/2016_Ballon_d%27Or" title="2016 Ballon d&#39;Or">2016</a>, <a href="/wiki/2017_Ballon_d%27Or" title="2017 Ballon d&#39;Or">2017</a>) and two <a href="/wiki/FIFA_Ballon_d%27Or" title="FIFA Ballon d&#39;Or">FIFA Ballon d'Or</a> (<a href="/wiki/2013_FIFA_Ballon_d%27Or" title="2013 FIFA Ballon d&#39;Or">2013</a>, <a href="/wiki/2014_FIFA_Ballon_d%27Or" title="2014 FIFA Ballon d&#39;Or">2014</a>), as well as the <a href="/wiki/2008_FIFA_World_Player_of_the_Year" title="2008 FIFA World Player of the Year">2008 FIFA World Player of the Year</a> and <a href="/wiki/The_Best_FIFA_Football_Awards_2016" title="The Best FIFA Football Awards 2016">2016</a> and <a href="/wiki/The_Best_FIFA_Football_Awards_2017" title="The Best FIFA Football Awards 2017">2017</a> <a href="/wiki/The_Best_FIFA_Men%27s_Player" title="The Best FIFA Men&#39;s Player">Best FIFA Men's Player</a> awards.</span>
</li>
<li id="cite_note-201"><span class="mw-cite-backlink"><b><a href="#cite_ref-201">^</a></b></span> <span class="reference-text">Real Madrid had previously recognized Ronaldo as their all-time top scorer after he scored a brace against <a href="/wiki/Malm%C3%B6_FF" title="Malmö FF">Malmö FF</a> on 30 September 2015. The club's official record book attributes to Ronaldo a 74th-minute goal in a 2–1 win over <a href="/wiki/Real_Sociedad" title="Real Sociedad">Real Sociedad</a> on 18 September 2010, despite his free-kick having been deflected by <a href="/wiki/Pepe_(footballer,_born_1983)" title="Pepe (footballer, born 1983)">Pepe</a>.<sup id="cite_ref-200" class="reference"><a href="#cite_note-200">&#91;197&#93;</a></sup></span>
</li>

<li id="cite_note-425"><span class="mw-cite-backlink"><b><a href="#cite_ref-425">^</a></b></span> <span class="reference-text">

<div role="navigation" class="navbox" aria-labelledby="Portugal_squad_–_2006_FIFA_World_Cup_fourth_place" style="padding:3px"><table class="nowraplinks vcard mw-collapsible autocollapse navbox-inner" Dzagoev">Dzagoev</a>, <span class="flagicon"><a href="/wiki/Germany_national_football_team" title="Germany national football team"><img alt="Germany" href="/wiki/Mario_Mand%C5%BEuki%C4%87" title="Mario Mandžuki">Mandžuki</a>, <span class="flagicon"><a href="/wiki/Portugal_national_football_team" title="Portugal national football team"><img 2x" data-file-width="750" data-file-height="500" /></a></span> <a href="/wiki/Fernando_Torres" title="Fernando Torres">Torres</a><sup>*</sup></span></li>
<li><span class="nowrap"><b><a href="/wiki/UEFA_Euro_2016" title="UEFA Euro 2016">2016</a>:</b> <span class="flagicon"><a href="/wiki/France_national_football_team" title="France national football team"><img alt="France" src="//upload.wikimedia.org/wikipedia/en/thumb/c/c3/Flag_of_France.svg/15px-Flag_of_France.svg.png" decoding="async" width="15" height="10" class="thumbborder" srcset="//upload.wikimedia.org/wikipedia/en/thumb/c/c3/Flag_of_France.svg/23px-Flag_of_France.svg.png 1.5x, //upload.wikimedia.org/wikipedia/en/thumb/c/c3/Flag_of_France.svg/30px-Flag_of_France.svg.png 2x" data-file-width="900" data-file-height="600" /></a></span> <a href="/wiki/Antoine_Griezmann" title="Antoine Griezmann">Griezmann</a></span></li></ul>
</div></td></tr><tr><td class="navbox-abovebelow" colspan="2" style="background:#FFD700;color:#00008B;"><div>*: Golden Boot award winner (when goals scored are tied)</div></td></tr></tbody></table></div>
<div role="navigation" class="navbox" aria-labelledby="UEFA_European_Championship_winning_captains" style="padding:3px"><table class="nowraplinks mw-collapsible autocollapse navbox-inner" style="border-spacing:0;background:transparent;color:inherit"><tbody><tr><th scope="col" class="navbox-title" colspan="2" style="background: gold;"><link rel="mw-deduplicated-inline-style" href="mw-data:TemplateStyles:r992953826"/><div class="navbar plainlinks hlist navbar-mini"><ul><li class="nv-view"><a href="/wiki/Template:UEFA_European_Championship_winning_captains" title="Template:UEFA European Championship winning captains"><abbr title="View this template" style=";background: gold;;background:none transparent;border:none;box-shadow:none;padding:0;">v</abbr></a></li><li class="nv-talk"><a href="/wiki/Template_talk:UEFA_European_Championship_winning_captains" title="Template talk:UEFA European Championship winning captains"><abbr title="Discuss this template" style=";background: gold;;background:none transparent;border:none;box-shadow:none;padding:0;">t</abbr></a></li><li class="nv-edit"><a class="external text" href="https://en.wikipedia.org/w/index.php?title=Template:UEFA_European_Championship_winning_captains&amp;action=edit"><abbr title="Edit this template" style=";background: gold;;background:none transparent;border:none;box-shadow:none;padding:0;">e</abbr></a></li></ul></div><div id="UEFA_European_Championship_winning_captains" style="font-size:114%;margin:0 4em"><a href="/wiki/UEFA_European_Championship" title="UEFA European Championship">UEFA European Championship</a> winning captains</div></th></tr><tr><td colspan="2" class="navbox-list navbox-odd hlist" style="width:100%;padding:0px"><div style="padding:0em 0.25em">

<li><b><a href="/wiki/UEFA_Euro_1968" title="UEFA Euro 1968">1968</a>:</b> <span class="flagicon"><a href="/wiki/Italy_national_football_team" title="Italy national football team"><img alt="Italy" src="//upload.wikimedia.org/wikipedia/en/thumb/0/03/Flag_of_Italy.svg/15px-Flag_of_Italy.svg.png" decoding="async" width="15" height="10" class="thumbborder" srcset="//upload.wikimedia.org/wikipedia/en/thumb/0/03/Flag_of_Italy.svg/23px-Flag_of_Italy.svg.png 1.5x, //upload.wikimedia.org/wikipedia/en/thumb/0/03/Flag_of_Italy.svg/30px-Flag_of_Italy.svg.png 2x" data-file-width="1500" data-file-height="1000" /></a></span> <a href="/wiki/Giacinto_Facchetti" title="Giacinto Facchetti">Facchetti</a></li>
